author: Grass4Mower7
title: Good App,BUT...
content: A few days ago I followed the directions given and ended up in a very dangerous situation on the side of a mountain. I was pulling a large fifth wheel trailer and the maps led us onto a road that would have required us to back up for 2-3 miles to get out. So, we pressed forward following the map up the mountain and all of a sudden we came to a switchback or hairpin turn in the road without any warning. Since there wasn't any way of turning around and no chance of backing up we pressed on. Then again without warning we came to another switchback in the road. By this time the grade on the road was greater than 6%; I estimated between 6 and 8%. This time trying to get around the corner required us put our lives and property at risk. We had to pile stones etc. in the ditch for the trailer tires to drive on and drove the truck way out within inches of the edge of the cliff to get around. The camper cleared the wall by about 3 inches. We ended up damaging the truck and camper making that turn! If we had been alerted to the kind of road we were going travel on we would have selected another route. Google Maps needs to either advise about roads like that before routing anyone down them or create a setting that allows for the vehicle type (trailers, campers, motor homes) and route them onto roads safe for travel. I hope Google does something about this before someone is injured or killed.

author: EDM4LIFE92
title: Best app for Navigation, PERIOD
content: I absolutely love Google maps, way more than the joke of a maps app apple tried cramming down our throats back with the release of iOS 6.  Don't get me wrong, the 3D flyover feature on Apple maps is nice to just browse around and kill some time, but if you want a proper navigation app with accurate and up to date business listings being the maps are constantly updated by users, this is hands down my all time favorite navigation app.  Sure, Waze may have some useful features, but isn't always accurate with traffic conditions being those are updated by users, while googles traffic service uses your GPS data and uses your speed and  the speed from other users around you to give you a pretty accurate speed and traffic function on Google Maps.  Sure some may think that google using your GPS data is like spying on you, but they only use that bit of GPS data is to give up to date traffic conditions. It's not tracking where you walk or shop or get directions too, it just uses GPS data coming from your phone when moving at more than a brisk walking pace, so above 10+ MPH it's using your GPS Data for traffic.  I love Google Maps, just wish they had a 3D setting like Apple maps does and like how Google earth has it, but they should incorporate that 3D city/building modeling abilities into standard Google Maps.

author: Ofjeida
title: Fix bug
content: Please fix the bug where I will be driving on the road and Google maps suddenly tells me I'm on a completely different road and reroutes before it figures out where I am

author: kew2010
title: Overall great, weird with neighborhood wifi and other suggestions
content:
I'm a huge fan of google maps. Love the integration of bike, walk and public transit! Here's what I wish the app for iPhone did/would do better:
-Quick button access to drive home or work. I used the Google travel times widget and think that is incredibly helpful, but I think it could also be integrated into the app itself. Alternatively, I don't actually need to know how long it will take me to get to work, I just like the shortcut to open the app and navigate me home. Would it save battery life (and data) to offer a widget that just serves as shortcuts without travel times?
-My neighborhood and city is covered by wifi. I like that my phone automatically connects securely to Xfinity wifi, but it leaves my Google maps confused and unable to provide a route. I'm not sure if this is a bug, but the best solution I've found is to turn off wifi while searching for routes, then remember to turn wifi back on when I reach my destination.
-I'd like to be able to scroll through traffic at different times during a day on the app (like you can online). It is annoying when I search the distance/travel time to a place but realize the app is showing rush hour/real time that will not apply to when I want to start my drive on Saturday AM.

author: Msmoellie
title: Used to love this app
content: Don't like to recent changes that force me on to toll roads even when it does not save time!! Will force me to use another app!  I've always felt that this app was far superior to the one that comes preloaded on my iPhone, so I for years I have taken the time to manually type in the address versus taking the shortcut that goes directly to the iPhone maps.  (I wish the iPhone would allow me to choose the map of my choice but that's another issue) lately however I've noticed that Google maps will navigate me onto the express lanes (Toll roads) that run parallel to the highways even when there is not any additional traffic on the main highways. The App will show me options to take other routes, but it will not offer me the option to take the parallel non-toll road.  Why is the app adamant about forcing me onto toll roads?  Are you getting kickbacks?

author: Hung65
title: Update
content: Is there a reason this app has to update every goddamn day?  Deleting

author: rpdplays
title: Improvements
content: Use when driving for Lyft and Uber. Recently, it's having problems loading when hitting navigation button in both uber and lyft maps. Have to do it several times to load which is frustrating. The maps are clear to use except when you get very close to the destination. When you get close to the destination it displays the latitude and longitude instead of the address. And then once you get to the destination and the directions stop immediately and the screen goes dark. I have to tap the screen again, hoping the screen doesn't lock, to get phone back and go back to car sharing app. If I'm on a street where it's tough to find the address, I need the map to stay active. I use the satellite feature so use the buildings outline and address to make sure I'm in the best place. The alley bug seems to be improved. Glad they brought back seeing different routes with one touch rather than two touches.

author: M3mph1sKyle
title: Must be a nice deal they have with toll companies
content:
Update! Be sure to check other routes carefully. The app will now ignore faster routes to direct you down toll roads. Sometimes it won't even show the faster route until you select "avoid tolls!" That's ridiculous, just because I'm willing to take tolls, does not mean I want to spend $10 on a slower route. 

I have also had the app redirect during the route (common) and just turn tolls right back on for no reason. This is super helpful when you don't know an area, lose perfect signal for half a second in downtown, then just follow the guidance out. By the time you're to the highway, the faster, non-toll route is now behind you bad would take much longer. I've paid closer attention and this is something that happens regularly. It doesn't happen every time the app tries to reroute for no reason, but just make sure to check your route after it does. 

Because this app seems to get off on making you take tolls. The 'remember settings' button won't remember to avoid tolls. Worse, even if YOU remember, there's a chance the app will reroute through tolls without your consent.

author: Scott_Davidson
title: Rideshare issues
content: Doesn't integrate properly with Lyft or Uber driver apps. In the Lyft app, when it auto navigates or I have to click on the Navigate Tab (auto navigate is turned on and it works fine wth Waze), instead of navigating me, if I'm lucky you'll show me a "preview" of the route to the given address but you won't navigate me there. I have to back out of that function at least two steps in hopes that you'll sometimes give me the option to manually tap on the little "go" button or the little triangle to finally get directions. Waze integrates perfectly with Lyft but I don't feel safe using Waze because it lacks lane assist technology. It's too unsafe to spend all my time and energy taking my eyes of the road just to fight with a navigation app in hopes to make it work for me before my passenger cancels on me. You're supposed to be the best navigation app out there. You would be my go to app. Half the time I have to close Google Maps and restart it just to get it to work with Lyft while in traffic. The auto navigate function including route pickup/drop off/stop changes and auto cancel route functions along with a button for easy switching between Google Maps and the rideshare driver's app should work just as it does with Waze. Update: This version apparently gives me weird notifications sometimes even when the app is closed. It's not constant, but it has happened a few times and somehow is working against my Uber Driver notifications while getting trip requests.

author: Plzchangeit
title: Please
content: Bring back the banner that allows you to see your next turn by swiping the banner to the left. I am a driver that knows about 2/3 of the route and want to see the unknown part of my route. The drop down banner is useless because I can't see the directions while driving given the small font and it's hard to make sense of what line to read. Since taking that away I almost collided into several cars in the city of Chicago. If you don't want to fully bring it back can you at least make it an option. Literally begging you.

author: nutella_98
title: "User experience" defined by Google has a brand new meaning
content:
Why does an extra chunk of "Explore food and drink around this area" label cluttering and covering up the map, thereby wasting valuable space!?

I have noticed lately that google is becoming a collection of unexperienced teenagers fresh out of college with no actual experience in life (besides holding your iPhone while sitting on the toilet) who think the only reason one using a map is to search for something to eat and drink.

What's next? Why don't you add a couple of more labels over the map, you know, just to clutter up the space and degrade user experience. Here are a few ideas: "Discover gas stations / pharmacies / car dealerships / train stations / police stations / post offices / grocery stores / etc around this area." Position all these labels neatly floating over and across the map, so that the actual usable map area will be reduced to about one square inch on a 9.7 inch iPad. Then create an option to hide these floating labels somewhere in the menu, but make sure you hide this option deep inside some weird menu hierarchy where people wouldn't even think to look. Isn't google user experience golden...!?

iPad 3 / iOS 9.3.5

author: A Google customer
title: Just some thoughts...
content: I enjoy using the google maps app very much, it is generally very useful. That being said I have some ideas on how to improve the offline version. #1 add multiple route options, having only one way to go can be very frustrating when there is a detour or snow blocking the road or another problem with the road. #2 make the downloadable area bigger, I know that having so much map area in a phone will take up a lot of space, however if you provided the option to have a bigger map size then the final decision would be up to the consumer and could help eliminate the need for so many offline maps. #3 please change it so that you can use topographic and satellite maps when offline, I take my device backpacking and having that extra capability would be helpful for planning which route to take and it would also be helpful if you are looking for a specific place but you don't know the address . Thank you for your time and I hope that my input will help you evolve google maps to a more useful tool for the common person.

author: AJGoods
title: Verbal diarrhea!
content: The google maps voice proudly tells me periodically it is on the fastest route, why does it do this when I told it to navigate by the fastest route? If it was on a slow route it would be not following instructions, so telling me it is on the fastest route is just verbal diarrhea! On the bottom of the screen there is a box to click for exploring food or drinks near me, what if I prefer to find gas stations, banks, parking, airports or anything else? Although I am on the larger side it is a bit presumptious of the google people to think I always want to drink or eat! Another annoyance is that it that when I save a location it shows me all the details of that location; address, phone number, website, and photo, I don't need all this info, just list saved locations with the name I give them, I can figure out the rest! Google maps route selection is often not the best but the street view is still its best feature, apart from that the app works alright but there is plenty of room for improvement. There is still an obvious pathetic rivalry between google and apple that cripples both their mapping apps to the detrement of the user.

author: Mrk4110
title: Huh?
content:
When starting navigation it puts my starting position in the wrong place and then moves to my current location and gets stuck on relocating.

author: Paul in NJ
title: How Can You Not Love This?
content: I have gotten to the point where despite having a built-in GPS in my car, I use this app more than half the time because it is so incredibly accurate. With the downloadable maps, it greatly eases demand on your data limits and frees you up to use it more frequently. The voice speaks clearly and at a good tempo, and you are given a heads up ‚Äì and a automatic re-routing ‚Äì when you run into traffic. If that weren't enough, it gives you a Welcome greeting every time you cross a state line. Even if you don't love this app, you should have it as a backup as you will find it useful at some point when your other resources have failed you. Highly recommend.

author: Vsqd
title: The newest version won't let you swipe through directions
content: This app was the best. Every time I thought I was going to switch to waze or another app, I always came back to google maps. It has been a trusty program for me, but no more. This latest update no longer lets you swipe through your route on the top of the maps on the green bar where the directions show up. Before, doing this allowed you to see the next step while the map would fly to the next turn or move. Now if you swipe nothing, if you tap it it drops down written turn by turn directions. This is crap. Every maps app does this while locking the map. I am an extremely visual person and I can't retain or interpret a bunch of written directions without having to keep rereading them over and over again which is SO DANGEROUS WHILE DRIVING. The visual map follow through was a god send. Please bring it back for all your adhd users.

author: Dana Photo Girl
title: Great directions when it doesn't auto change my route
content: It has auto rerouted me several times. I've purposely chosen a slower more laid back route and mid route I realize it has changed after I've gone an additional 15 minutes down the new route. I didn't want to save a whopping  6 minutes and use the freeway and toll road which is why I chose my slower route. This route change should never be automatic. I had no cash for tolls. I had to turn around which caused me a 30 minute delay. This route change should be manual only. I have searched the entire app for the ability to turn this feature off with no luck.

author: Attention developer
title: Google's Traffic feature has been 'layered'
content:
I probably use the traffic feature more than anything else in the maps app.  Now it is harder to access and as far as I have seen so far, you have to set a destination to access it.  
If you know the routes you might take all you want is to see the traffic, why make it so difficult?  If this isn't set completely before starting to drive, forget getting traffic on Google Maps- will be unsafe.  Another thoughtless move by Google

author: rgalmeida34
title: YES!!!
content: BACK TO THE IPHONE AND BETTER THAN EVER. GOOGLE MAPS!!!

author: Hydrolysis21
title: Smarter than suri but talks too much
content:
I m not sure if google read my previous review but I noticed the change and i m mighty impressed! This kind of fast and perfect response is gonna fix our country! 
I think google map is by far a smarter and more helpful girlfriend than suri but her directions runs and runs. They r often spoken over an interesting point on a radio show i m listening to and then goes on and on when "stay left on freeway" is enough. It may also help if she gives the next turn way ahead so i know to switch lanes instead of having to cross 3 lanes of LA traffic when i find out i need to make a turn 50ft away from the junction. I don't usually give a lot of reviews but since my life will depend on google - i better put in my two cents

author: F. Parsay
title: Beyond Imaginable
content: The functionalities of Google Maps are awe inspiring and one needs to learn about them before having the benefits which are beyond imaginable. One will find out that it is not only about discovering and navigation but it is also about having the real time information and updates, and based on that, knowing what to do or not to do. The information also helps people to meet their needs in terms of reaching gas stations and their preferred coffee shops, restaurants and other businesses based on reviews and pictures. On top of all that people can use off line maps in the absence of internet and also indoor maps and a lot of other useful information. Google Maps presents a perfection through which provides the best services which are needed, valued and loved by all.

author: Techie tucker
title: Almost useless on IPad Pro 10.5
content:
Update. Two bug fixes since my review and problem still persists. Good news is it's a free app. 

Street view takes forever to load on the new IPad Pro 10.5, when it works at all. When it does work; about 1/2 the time, going back to the map view either crashes the app or more commonly, causes the app to freeze forcing me to force close the app and try again. Street view is pretty much the only reason to even use Google Maps over the built in Apple Maps application. This doesn't happen on my iPhone 7 or my iPad Air 2 or my wife's release edition IPad Pro 12.9 so it's got to be some kind of incompatibility with the new Pros. This needs to be fixed if it's too be at all useful.

author: Imadams
title: Why did you move my house?
content:
When I first got this app I set my address as home, with one of your many updates you decided I don't live where I say I do and moved my house marker to another street!! You did the same thing to my husband! You say our house is like 300 yards away! We live in a mobile home park that got the street names changed years ago and you still show the old names! Fix it so our house shows in the proper spot!!
Update: you keep asking me to rate you, yet you have not fixed the problem! My house still shows in the wrong spot, the street names in our neighborhood still show the names from several years ago even though, my husband, some of our neighbors, and I have sent you feedback about the new names!

author: Want my coffee.
title: Google Map Update Sept 6, 2017
content: Before this latest update, I only had to set the map detail option for traffic once so that every time the app was opened it would automatically show traffic. üòé Now after the latest update, you have to click on the traffic option EVERY TIME to see the traffic after opening. üòûüòûüòûüòû What happened. Please fix this problem. Other than that I will need a little time to play with the updated app it to see what's what.

author: birddmann
title: Can't set traffic view as default
content: In the previous versions of Google Maps, if the user selected traffic view, that setting stuck -- every time you opened the app thereafter, traffic view was on by default. In the latest version, the geniuses at Google have decided for some bizarre reason that, in order to view traffic, the user should be forced to select that setting every time they open the app. It's a perfect example of the cluelessness of the Silicon Valley overlords -- or maybe just an example of how little they care about the user experience.

author: Handles08
title: Latest update removed traffic on by default
content: If you use this app for traffic DO NOT UPDATE.  Traffic previously was on by default, that is no longer the case, and there is no way to change it.  Every time you want to check the traffic, you have to go into the layers and now turn traffic back on.  Close the app, and then come back in, guess what, traffic is gone again!  After about the 3rd time of, "why is there traffic, my app said there was no traffic?!"  Oh... pos turned turned traffic off with the update.  Rip.  App is usually 5 stars.  Latest update made it infuriating.  Fix traffic on by default, or let us manually turn traffic on and leave it on, and you'll go back to 5 stars.

author: KMaggard
title: Google Maps
content: Love love love this app! I was using the app that was already on my phone to guide me to a vacation spot. That app was wrong so many times that I'd have to reboot the app or even my entire phone. It's not like my destination was a small off grid town, it was Destin FL!  Thank goodness I found the app about 1/2 to my destination, & downloaded it! I was able to drive right to our hotel with ZERO turnarounds & waiting for it to recalibrate.

author: LuckySpark317
title: Traffic Layer Fixed
content:
Update: The latest version now leaves the traffic layer on when you start the app. Thank you! Now...can you make the previous zoom level a default for the next start up?

Previous version: The traffic layer has to be selected everytime you open the app. Need to fix this back to how it was before. Keep user's last selections as the default when reopening the app. Addition of "as the crow flies" distance measurement is a long time coming.

author: Brittany Vigil
title: Practical, Accurate, Perfect!
content: First off I live in Phoenix so my review is based mostly off of my usage there. However I was a flight attendant for some time and used maps in just about every US State, Canada, Mexico, Italy, and England, and Scotland and it will remain my #1 choice for navigation software.  I've been using Google Maps since Google decided to start mapping! It was a godsend when things like MapQuest were the only services available and has only gotten better over time. I love how seamlessly it integrates with websites, apps, programs, and software across a number of different industries. It is available on every platform which I know to be in existence and is useful for just about any purpose, whether it's looking up an address, locating a business, acquiring directions, determining route times by method of transportation (in my city it even offers Uber or Lyft rates), sharing information, researching the surrounding area of a location using street view, or simply checking out the terrain for a hike or a bike ride. They do it all, they do it accurately and effectively. But most importantly they do it safely (i.e. there is no option to take your eyes off the road to let fellow drivers know there is a cop monitoring your speed).

author: The Greatest Family Dog
title: Good app
content: This is a great app. Literally would be lost without it. Had a suggestion from a friend. Make option of "travel with stops" to factor into ETA. Like 10 min or 15 min every 2 hrs or something.

author: The Blonde Cookie
title: WHAT does the update DO?
content:
If you actually want folks to do the update, try telling them WHAT it fixes. Y'all have taken the L-A-Z-Y way out, with the "bug fixes" description. 

And frankly, I'm kinda steamed, and thinking about dumping the app - the last THREE times I needed directions to somewhere, I couldn't get the app to direct me to where I needed to go. Since I haven't lived in this area very long, that's EXTREMELY inconvenient, not to mention aggravating. What the heck is THAT about? I'm not a technoboob, I can usually figure apps out. And I've had this app for a while. But since the last "update" (not this one, the previous one), I can't get it to work. Good thing I'm old skool, and can read a map.

author: Busboyrc
title: Recent update kills reliability
content: I am constantly having issues with this app when I've never had them before. I pretty much have to kill the app from the background and then open it at least twice before it starts working. My issues are just random freezing, it will find the destination and when you click start it will just hang one the overview of the route and doesn't zoom in to your location (but after killing it and opening again that same destination is in the recent places at least), constant rerouting issues, the voice guide will just either say the same thing like five times or will start rapping because she cuts herself off like "cont... cont... cont... cont... stay on us 101 for 5 miles... continue on the..." I will have issues with the sound saying it's muted and I can't enable it because iPhone volume is to low after turning it off silent and checking the sound is all the way up with the volume rocker and confirming it's all the way up from the quick menu by sliding up from the bottom of the screen and then left to see the music tab.  I've also had issues with it not following me and then not showing a recenter button and if you don't notice this is happening then the voice guidance doesn't trigger so I'm often finding myself passing turns only to have a rap battle with her.  I've never used apple maps and all my stuff is google but man this app is really trying me recently. Please for the love of all things holy fix these issues.

author: Nigel Thorn
title: Need all features on app that are on web version (traffic at specific time/date)
content: I love google maps and trust my life with it whenever I go anywhere, but I would love to be able to use the feature that's on the web version that allows me to check for directions with avg. traffic at a specific time/day. A lot of time I need to see what the normal drive time would be on a weekday morning, even though I'm checking it at 9pm the night before and that feature should be easily integrated into the app version. It's also frustrating that I cannot even go to chrome and use the maps website feature without it connecting directly to my app version when I'm trying to get this done on my ipad. Otherwise, great app.

author: Bob Dole's PB
title: Specifically on Share Location fxn
content: It's hard to do anything but extol Google Maps for iOS. I mean it's dangerously good at being a map app. So I thought I'd weigh in on a particular feature: the new Share Location function. I love that the team brought this back (G+ had it but it was difficult to find and use). When this hit I immediately deleted Find My Friends and cackled maniacally. But now my fianc√©e and I are having a debate about it. She asserts FMF has a quicker refresh whereas (to date) location data in Google Maps seem to be constantly behind‚Äîin fact at this very moment her location is 2 hours in since last update and her phone is presently on and connected. Whatever is the issue my guess is that you can close that gap in no time.

author: Jegsrmocb
title: So much better
content: I used to use the Apple map but it often had the wrong spot for an address. Often!  This app is so much more accurate and helpful. I love how it will say, You can use the two left lanes to turn...  when you're on the interstate or freeway and the Apple map says turn left at the exit. () you think that you might have to get all the way over and you do more lane changing than necessary.

author: F. Parsay
title: An Innovative Feature
content: Google Maps is a world view and an expression of wholeness of life. It presents to us the multidimensional aspects of life and living including what we can do to enrich and to improve things at each corner of our planet. Google Maps has a comprehensive schematic of dynamics of life and an implicit and helpful dialogue with people through people. Google Maps is a discovery and learning tool and an innovative feature which will never stop expanding and reaching out for perfection.

author: mdestis
title: Used to love it - don't like new traffic changes
content:
I live in Atlanta, and keeping an eye on traffic is essential. I used to keep traffic on so if I had to turn the app on quickly to glance and my route and traffic it was easy. Now I have to turn it on every time I open the app and that is very inconvenient when almost always needing to do that. If that option can be changed back as it can just be left on as an option, that would make this app 5‚≠êÔ∏è

author: Jelly 984
title: Google maps is getting worse
content: I used to like google maps but after it couldn't find the correct address 3 different times over the past several weeks I am over it. Couldn't find the right location for an established restaurant in a large metropolitan city, steered me wrong when trying to find a business that had been there for years, and now is showing the wrong map location for a house. By looking at the address of the house, it is clear that the location is wrong on the map. I  also find that other apps which use google maps are displaying incorrect map locations. Will be deleting and finding a new app to try.

author: Ombekend
title: TAKE US BACK 2 ALGORITHMS!!!
content: I just moved to a new metropolitan area where I need a map to do everything!  Google Maps has been my loved app, until now. What happened?  I can be in the middle of a complex interchange (and my city doesn't list exits as Google calls them out) and Google will change my map right in the middle of the interchange!  I literally have been in heavy traffic and have been switched to taking an exit ramp in 1/4 mile across 3 lanes of traffic. What's not making any sense is that I'll be routed from a road without traffic to a road Google has painted red for very slow traffic FOR MILES. You have made many excursions that should have lasted a few minutes turn into hour long traffic nightmares. Please fix your app and return to the version two levels back. IT WAS PERFECT!!!

author: mike2128
title: Great updates but lost my favorite feature
content: The 3D Touch menu on the home screen icon used to have an option to navigate to either work or home in one press (technically two, I guess). This is now gone - the transit times are still shown and tapping one will set up for navigation, but this still requires you to hit "Go" once loaded. Minor inconvenience, but a regression in usability. I can't imagine people need to have such quick access to the "Your Contributions" section.

author: Heyyoucanfinish2356
title: Needs One touch list & preview
content:
-NEED DIRECTION LIST ONE TOUCH ACCESS. WHY PUT IT IN A DROP DOWN MENU AGAIN. ITS DANGEROUS.  WE HAD ONE TOUCH LIST AND RPUT PREVIEW. WHY DID YOU CHANG IT BACK. JERKS. 

1.---get rid up pop ups. We don't need to know route is clear. Or if there is traffic. The color coding and ETA time tells us that in one look.  Don't need a pop to say everything is normal.  
2.---HOME AND WORK SHOULD POP UP FIRST. what's the point of programming them in, if you still have to search for them?
3.---keep the destination on the same st. As the address. If it's 100 main st. Why do the directions say turn on Broadway. Main st is the address not another st.  Didn't ask to get close asked for exact location.

author: Arca the Crow
title: No transit!!
content: I really do LOVE Google maps, it's the only gps I use. However it doesn't get full stars because after a very long time, I'm still getting NO transit info whatsoever. I go to bus, I get Uber ads and a walking route. I make sure it's set to bus with less walking, I still ONLY get a walking route. A few years ago it worked fine. Nowadays it will not show and I haven't found any solutions or answers besides "it should show transit routes again".

author: Molly Faria
title: GPS shows my car not in true location, had to use a real map for a trip!
content: App used to work perfectly on my iPhone 6. Now it only lists the directions when I enter in my route from A to B, which I screen shot to follow because the GPS has my car driving off the route. If I'm on a highway, it shows my car on streets running next to it. My car has even appeared to drive on water when clearly I'm on a road. This is only good for highway driving, forget about once you get off & are on regular streets, you'll be shown on the map as a block or two away from your actual location. Confusing when your someplace new, trying to find a specific address.

author: nichola715
title: Older version was better
content: Hate that you can only see the next direction from the drop down menu. Scrolling it left was so much easier and actually let me see the future directions on the map. Please bring this feature back!!!

author: Cheapskate01
title: Still crashes on latest version of iPad Pro
content:
25 Jul 17 - still not fixed.
13 Jul 17 - still not fixed 

I got my new iPad Pro about four updates ago and the first thing I noted was that Google Maps crashes when trying to use Street View.  This crash is on my iPad Pro only; works on all my other Apple devices.  My wife has last year's iPad Pro; no problem there, either.

But I am very frustrated that this is the third update since I got my iPad Pro and this serious bug has not been fixed.

Maybe there's not a lot of NEW iPad Pro users out there.

Dear Google:  Please contact me that I can explain this bug to you!

author: Jamchemist
title: Great app! Here's how to improve it...
content: Google maps is a great app. I love my iPhone like nothing else but Google Maps beats the Maps on the phone by a long way and I always use it on short and long trips! Maps is only just playing catchup. If I could delete it, I would. I agree with a previous reviewer that a future update of Google maps should include speed limits. Would be even cooler if it could remind the driver, if he happens to be going over the  listed speed limit. Can the GPS detect speed? I'd think it could... Or maybe just have the app remind the driver of the limit each time it makes an announcement on directions. It is great Google maps shows on the listed directions where the toll booth would be... I would love for it to tell me how much the toll is!! Lol I visited a few family members in NYC and NJ recently and it seems every major expressway has a toll!! Would be great if I could plan a trip around where to pay less toll etc. Thanks for an awesome app and keep up the good work!!

author: Fouchizzle49
title: Senior Lady
content:
No more paper maps that you can't easily read!  Best navigation tool. Directs you the best and quickest way to your destination. Includes options to locate hotels, restaurants, and points of interest.  Perfect for the lone driver. I used it for the time on a cross country trip. The audio commands were amazing, allowing plenty of time to maneuver through traffic. It even announced estimated time of arrival, how many miles you will travel on a particular highway, and tragic delays, including accidents. Once I arrived at my destination, I used it every time when driving locally.  
I cannot say enough about this app. It makes your driving experience easier and enjoyable. I suggest using the Google app as well.  Your voice commands makes it convenient for hands free driving. 
For the backseat driver, relax, be confident with this app that your driver will get you to your destination. I missed my exit one time and ended up in a downtown college area that was under construction. No problem. Google maps is up to date, and I was easily directed through the area in a timely manner, and back on the road again.  
KUDOS to Google. I never leave home without it!

author: KitsuneNights
title: Is it even a question?
content:
I live in a city that uses bus lines and trains to get around the city and parts outside the city. This App is better than any schedule that you would get from the buses or trains, even telling you when there is a delay!

So yeah, opening a booklet that can cover a whole office desk with run times that most of the time are anywhere from 5 to 15 minutes off the real time, or an app that not only gives you the time and show you where, but tells you a good time to get there ahead of time so you don't miss it!

Yeah gonna stick with this app!

author: StuccInTraffic
title: Why did you hide traffic....
content:
Under a layer of abstraction? I must have missed when the last update happened, but the app no longer launches with the traffic layer already shown. You have to either select it w/ two menu taps or start a navigation in its current version; 4.36.7.  This makes the app super unfortunate to use now. Would you pretty please at least make it an option to launch w/ traffic shown?
 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

author: CkLance
title: Google Maps
content: No matter which map (Apple or Microsoft) system you use, you subconsciously (or consciously) compare it to Google Maps.

author: Pat12789
title: Recent change to traffic settings needs fixed
content:
Love this app as my main navigation tool. It's better than even the paid navigation apps. However, the recent change to require the user to activate traffic display after launching the app (vs a default setting) was a bad decision. The app has become less useful for me.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÂõûÂ§çÔºöThank you for letting us know about this issue, and your patience as we fixed the problem. We appreciate it! With the latest update, Google Maps should now be working as usual.

author: GML25
title: Please have traffic remain on when selected.
content:
Like others have noted, since the last update I have to turn on traffic every single time I open the app (or it's been inactive too long). That is the MAIN feature I use it for on a mobile device. Please fix the setting so it retains that preference.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÂõûÂ§çÔºöThank you for letting us know about this issue, and your patience as we fixed the problem. We appreciate it! With the latest update, Google Maps should now be working as usual.

author: Aminhas2014
title: Traffic data
content:
I usually use the app while driving so I need to see the traffic quickly. With the last update, the traffic details have to be turned ob every time I open the app which quite inconvenient. I believe the app would be better with an option to always show the traffic data.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÂõûÂ§çÔºöThank you for letting us know about this issue, and your patience as we fixed the problem. We appreciate it! With the latest update, Google Maps should now be working as usual.

author: Oisact
title: Traffic layer now off by default
content:
Not a good update. One of the main things I use this app for is traffic. I quickly pull it up, often while driving, to see if the roads are "green" or if there are traffic issues. Up until this version it remembered my traffic layer setting so traffic was already enabled when I started the app. Now it is always off by default, so I have to screw around in settings to enable it, often while trying to drive. Not cool.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÂõûÂ§çÔºöThank you for letting us know about this issue, and your patience as we fixed the problem. We appreciate it! With the latest update, Google Maps should now be working as usual.

author: La Tutty
title: Love it!
content: Very accurate and love the layout of the map and directions.

author: BuffDaddyDeluxe
title: 3D touching does not work
content: The update states you can 3D touch on the map. Wrong, 3D touch died not work anywhere in the app. Stupid

author: KC1974
title: Getting worse and poor x-platform implementation
content:
Update:
The LAST update on 5/10 put layers back where they were in the side menu (and where they are on Android). Wonderful!

THIS update on 5/11 - the "bug fix" was to put them back on the screen along with a text box telling us they're there.. Seriously??! At some point I'd actually like to see, you know, the map underneath..

Original review:
Layers now via an icon on screen. Wonderful except it covers up part of the screen, which is why the side bar was useful - which is still there! There's just less in it now.
Timeline - finally - but apparently I haven't been anywhere for 2 weeks since 4/14.
What used to be a 2 click process to view the overall route and choose alternate routes while navigating is now a 4 click process. Seriously? While driving, make it more difficult?
The Android UI and iOS UI are now no longer in sync. I use both.
If it ain't broke - don't fix it.
Aside from the traffic info which is still great, this is getting worse. Still better than Apple Maps though.

author: jack_s12
title: Does Not Update
content: Tried to update to the latest version. Says "unable to download" even though connection is fine. please fix

author: Matt2195
title: Audio
content: Would love to send audio through my iPhone speakers when plugged into the USB of my car. Waze can do this why can't goog maps

author: Icaro Satsuma
title: LOVE!!
content: My husband and I drove into completely unfamiliar territory last weekend. I was planning to ask Siri for directions through town and to our hotel, but I ended up using the Google Maps app instead. I was AMAZED at how great it worked! At one point on the way home, we got distracted and took a wrong turn. No problem!! By using the app, I was easily able to plot a course to get us back on track. Also, we used the app to find restaurants the whole weekend. This app is da bomb!!

author: FREE BIRD //
title: Dangerous Sometimes
content:
I love G-maps. The only and only problem I have is the "Second Turn Notification". 
Guys! the way google map performs when you exit the freeways with immediate turns (north, south, west or east) is extremely confusing. 
Let's use 405 North exiting Wiltshire blvd as an example. 
The map asks you to exit Wiltshire Blvd but there's no way to find out if you need to take east or west. 
Those 2 are immediate turns after you exit the freeway so the highlighted rout will change when you exit the freeway in "2"! Seconds after you need to decide to take either West or East. 

Solution: please work on the second turn notification carefully. The map needs to indicate the next exit clearly in advance. 

The highlighted rout is useless in many cases. Get rid of that and show only where you need to go exactly. The highlighted rout sometimes appears only a few seconds before the driver needs to make a decision on turns. 
Please fix that issue.

author: Kokimoto81
title: This app is getting worse and worse
content:
One of the best apps ever, but with the last few updates they totally ruined it. I've been using it for more than 10 years and all I can say is that I loved it. I even deleted the not so good Apple Maps from my phone cause I thought I won't ever need it. Not anymore. 
The problems started few months ago. First problem: when I get directions and I try to zoom in to see something, it always zooms out by itself and that is very annoying. I have to stop the directions if I want to zoom. Second problem (and the most important for me as a semi truck driver) is the satellite images. It started loading them very slowly and now It doesn't even load them at all. So now the app is pretty much useless for me. As a truck driver I always need to check the places where I pick up and deliver loads so I don't stuck somewhere. I need to see how the parking lots and streets look like, where the entrances and driveways are and stuff like that. 
I don't know if it's s just my phone that causing those problems but it doesn't make sense to me cause I don't have any problems with other apps that are using Google Maps. And also my IPhone 6S Plus works flawlessly!

author: Scott_Davidson
title: Rideshare issues
content: Doesn't integrate properly with Lyft or Uber driver apps. In the Lyft app, when it auto navigates or I have to click on the Navigate Tab (auto navigate is turned on and it works fine wth Waze), instead of navigating me, if I'm lucky you'll show me a "preview" of the route to the given address but you won't navigate me there. I have to back out of that function at least two steps in hopes that you'll sometimes give me the option to manually tap on the little "go" button or the little triangle to finally get directions. Waze integrates perfectly with Lyft but I don't feel safe using Waze because it lacks lane assist technology. It's too unsafe to spend all my time and energy taking my eyes of the road just to fight with a navigation app in hopes to make it work for me before my passenger cancels on me. You're supposed to be the best navigation app out there. You would be my go to app. Half the time I have to close Google Maps and restart it just to get it to work with Lyft while in traffic. The auto navigate function including route pickup/drop off/stop changes and auto cancel route functions along with a button for easy switching between Google Maps and the rideshare driver's app should work just as it does with Waze.

author: loving series
title: Enjoying the Google Maps
content: I love the Google Maps.  They are usually accurate. They even include some real-time traffic information.  It helps sometimes more accurately than the GPS to use the Google Maps.

author: LittleBigtruckthatcd
title: Latest update wont show satellite view
content: I can't get satellite images after update. Restarted phone two times and changed signal from LTE to WiFi and still nothing. Please fix

author: Call me Rere
title: Not Good!
content: Google Maps is not always correct. Often times the GPS route me off me set destination. I don't like how Google Maps send me on a detour trying to get me lost, kidnapped, & killed. Double check your directions on another GPS site before committing to using Google Maps for final destination. Too many times Google Maps have gotten me lost. Taking me down streets that have nothing to do with my set location. I took a road trip last week and Google GPS told me to exit off the freeway and drive down a dark street. When my destination was still two hour drive on the freeway. Google Maps is unreliable! I have to always close out the app and retype in my destination to get another direction.

author: pcolamom07
title: What a lifesaver
content: I downloaded this app right before I left last week for my trip to Atlanta. A) I prefer this over apples maps which got my majorly lost my last trip. On this trip sections of I-85 and 400 were closed this mapped me shortcuts around and even rerouted while driving if there was an accident ahead. Huge help this trip due to the crazy traffic! I always got where I needed to be in a timely manner.

author: Sreaks
title: EXCELLENT but!!
content:
This is the best navigation app no doubt. There is a small concern for me, 
1) Whenever I type in a location I see ETA and distance in miles but once I choose a route the number of miles changes or increased a bit! Why not show the actual miles when selecting a route.
2) I guess "WAZE" is bought by google maps now and I would like one of the features to add in Google Maps as well, which is the speed to follow on each road along with the speed limit.

author: sillygirl99
title: Used to be my go to, now it won't even be my stand by
content:
After more than a few issues of getting crazy, around the world directions from Apple, I just downloaded Google maps & all was well, for a while...

The last 2-3 times I've used google maps, the experience hasn't even been what I would call sub-par, in one instance, google maps took me on a route so implausible as to be ridiculous. I went with it to see what would happen, even though I saw my destination, I followed googles directions & it took me past my turn, down the street, through a major intersection, then another 2 blocks, turned me right, then right at a 4 way a block down & then straight through a light, back right, right to where I was going, but it took me in a huge loop, WAY out of the way. 

This morning, unsure of the location of an office building, but aware of the actual area, I still use google maps just in case. Half a block BEFORE my destination it tells me to do a U turn. Had I not noticed I was at 120, instead of 301, I'd have been late. 

Second time in a week. I don't live in a terribly small town either, it's not the biggest, but far from the smallest. 

Going back to apple maps or buying an atlas.

author: Sloane Stradley
title: Please bring back the swipe functionality
content: I rely heavily on the swipe functionality to easily (and safely!) view upcoming directions. The design was perfect the way it was. The current directions preview causes way too much distraction on the road, and is very difficult to read at a glance. In fact, it's impossible to read at a glance. For the safety of myself, my beloved car, and other drivers on the road, please bring back the swipe functionality!

author: stephenbuck
title: Driving Hazard: pop-ups & required taps
content:
Well I like the amount of detail provided by Google maps, I find the pop-up notifications that provide redundant information (information that is already present on the map at a glance) to be a driving distraction and hazard. I frequently need to know what Data is being displayed when a pop-up text description occurs. That prevents me from obtaining essential information at the time I require it.

The application also requires me to tap several buttons to get to the desired navigation mode. That requires me to take my eyes off the road, and focus on tapping on the buttons to get it to do what I needed to do. That is a driving hazard.

author: amorinth
title: Finally figured out how to change it so it's not set to keep north autistically up
content:
I love this app. I've found that Google maps and Apple maps are pretty similar as far as user friendliness is concerned, but Google Maps can actually find my house and other locations I like to go to (my street was built about 4 years ago, but apple maps still can't find my house) 
For the longest time I could not figure out how to change the settings so the map wouldn't automatically point north. I hated that feature.

author: Cb1151996
title: App gets worse after each update
content: This app use to be great a year ago, but now after each update it gets worse and worse, first the app would start you at a different starting point then you are actually at, then the app would take you through a toll road even if it is toll roads are off, the fastest route became the slowest, and now the app wont open. Google really needs to tests there updates before launching them.

author: Neese67
title: What happened to traffic??
content: This was a 5 star app until the latest update took away the automatic traffic layer. I live in DC and NEED traffic updates and don't want to the hassle of turning on the traffic option every time I use the app (which is every day). Also, there is now a lag especially when approaching complex intersections which can create havoc when you suddenly need to be 3 lanes over.

author: Singhsg
title: Drop down directions
content: This drop down directions feature is ridiculous. The swipe right on top for next direction was convenient. Pretty bad description to Drop an essay in front of screen while driving!!! BAD Design...

author: Chelsea77Fan
title: Stop re-routing
content: Lately, every time I load a route from the options at the beginning of my trip, somewhere along the route GM changes that route without me knowing. I get it: most drivers want to get to the destination in the least amount of time, while avoiding any traffic issues. But there is a population of people with anxiety disorders who need to plan out their trips to avoid stressful situations like interstate travel, etc. Or maybe they want to avoid toll roads. Regardless of the reason why, travelers should have the option to adhere to their pre-determined route. Re-routing should be an option that can be turned off or on at the users discretion. Maybe I just want to take the long way to see what I can see. Currently, GM won't allow me to plan my trip the way *I* want to go.

author: 2caldwells
title: Over the river and through the woods
content: Google Maps used to be my go-to app for navigation, but in the last couple of versions it has begun routing me through residential neighborhoods and down back roads for several miles, when the obvious route would be 2 blocks to the state highway which then leads directly to the Interstate. Don't know what happened, but I just can't trust it now in unknown territory.

author: sorry4ever
title: Voice Nav Keeps Stopping
content:
Update to my last review:
I love Google Maps, but I always seem to have trouble getting the Voice Navigation to work, especially when I delete the app and reinstall it. I sometimes have to delete it because I run out of room on my iPhone 5s. Previous Review:
Maybe it's me, but every time I try to use Voice Navigation it just doesn't work. Then I have to pull the car over and get out the native Apple Map app and start all over again. The native Apple app is so much quicker and easier to use, and I have not had any problems with it so far. The thing that does not seem to work in the Google Map app is the VOICE part. No voice. It worked when the app started the route, but after I got a pop up reminder from my phone it stopped working. I will have to re-read the instructions. But I just feel that the Apple app for maps is better. At least at this time. If anything changes I will update my review.

author: mayhbvu
title: Updates don't work
content: I keep updating hoping the navigation issue would be fixed. Then I find myself trying to get to a location but the turn by turn navigation doesn't work and I'll look at the map and it shows that I'm still traveling around my starting point!!!

author: blahblahmah
title: I love it but...
content:
For some strange reason it keeps wanting to take toll roads and it keeps wanting to pass the destination up and make us do u-turns to return to the destination. 

Also, on the "fastest route," it seems to take the most ridiculous routes, and actually makes you take the streets beside the street that u need to be on or cut to the street right beside the street you should actually be on. 

I like the fact that it shows the traffic jams and gives estimated wait times, but I feel like if their was a traffic jam at 6:00 am, 300 miles away, the traffic jam should be removed (since the traffic no longer is jammed) by 1:30 pm...  and yes, I refreshed the route MORE THAN ONCE to see if it was still jammed. Took the same route and no, it was no longer jammed, but it was still showing a jam, several hours later.

author: Shota CS
title: Mapping is great
content: I have used this map many times and it's pretty accurate even with small towns. I've never actually driven with using it since I have a navi system in my car but worked great for a walking tour. Love the fact you can use it offline now since places I go don't always have wifi or data available.

author: rettwhizzer
title: Backwards
content: I more or less have all good things to say about Google maps except one feature that is maddening since one of the recent updates. Maybe I'm not normal I don't know but when I expand a map I use two fingers and when I want to move around the map I use one.  This is normal to me but sometime in the last month or two during one of the updates Google Maps, at least on the timeline feature that I use most often, this "normalcy" was reversed and it is now completely maddening to try to use the map if I want to zoom in and look closer at things or move the visible parts of the map around. Please put it back!!!

author: Laz730
title: Mrs. M
content: I used to love this app, but now the status bar is not there when im using the app and get out of it. I loved how i could easily tap the blue bar at top of my screen to get back to the map while driving. Now this is inconvenient. Please fix this issue.

author: magical mark
title: Version 4.34 will not open on iPhone 7
content:
This is a 5 star app. I updated to version 4.34 and now I can't open the app. 

I tried deleting the app and reinstalling. Please put the previous version back until the bug is fixed.

author: Nbcnxnx
title: Accurate and faster times than Apple Maps!!
content: I've always loved google maps. It shows you faster times and different options when there's traffic. Or always gives you a faster route. The Apple maps sometimes gives you a much longer journey and makes no sense. Definitely try it, you won't be disappointed and you'll be hooked!!

author: BayareaRidervfeedback
title: Loved it! But now getting worse with every update
content:
New post:  Now we have to turn on traffic every time we open the app...really?  And we can't edit route? New releases should should increase functionality,  it take it away. 

Previous post:Seems my google traffic color indicators vary when i zoom in or out.  Not consistent anymore when zooming. Zoom out i see lots of red, zoom in, traffic problems looked resolved.  Very confusing.

author: Justyna K.
title: App forgets my route
content: I've always liked Google maps, and most of the features are useful and work well. But now the app stops giving me directions if I stray from my route for any amount of time and I don't have a data connection. For instance, if I pull off a rest stop for two minutes and get right back on the highway, it suddenly has no clue what I should do next or how many miles until my next turn, merge, etc. It does, however, know exactly where I am and still have my route highlighted. It just loses all powers of calculation. This isn't particularly useful, as I need to be watching the road, not staring at my phone wondering how much farther until my next turn. Older versions didn't have this issue. My entire route was automatically saved locally and once I got back on it the app picked up right where it left off. I frequently drive through rural areas, so this issue is kind of a dealbreaker.

author: litase
title: Next update please!!
content: Would love to be able to see up coming side street names and would also like for the destination address to be announced.  Awesome app besides that!!

author: morgenbess
title: Still love it, but bring back one feature please
content: This is still my map app of choice and like it much better than Apple's map app, but please bring back the option of being able to swipe to the left to see the next direction..  Not a fan of the tapping the bar to bring up a list of directions.  Give us the option of choosing the swipe to the left option and/or the tap for next direction option.

author: Legendmc007
title: WOW!
content:
I have been using Apple Maps for quite sometime. When I am traveling, I use the direction feature and have not been satisfied. 
The other day I was trying to find a street and had nothing but problems. The directions did not make sense and the voice command feature rarely works with Bluetooth.
Enter Google Maps! WOW! Bluetooth works flawlessly, directions are easy to follow and timely! I have been using it for a few days now, and it is definitely my go-to phone navigator!
I have been an Apple devotee since 1987... I still am, but Google Maps is the bomb!

author: kevin318878787
title: Route auto update
content: Was trying to take the scenic route along the coast of Maine and without realizing it, googlemaps switched back to the faster route- almost missed our exit. It went on to change the route back 3 more times until we turned it off. After a couple times I started watching it and realized it does give you a chance to dismiss the faster route, but if I specifically chose the slower route, so it seems that should be the default, not the faster route.

author: pigybank
title: Cannot believe all the 5 star reviews
content: I am a rideshare driver in the Seattle area.  After using Apple maps for more than 2 years I was forced to switch to Google maps by the company I drive with.   I've heard all the Apple maps horror stories but that was never my experience.  With Google maps I have had constant nightmarish problems. It doesn't know when roads are closed as well or often as Apple maps did, and is essentially useless for rerouting around traffic.  It often freezes or crashes and sometimes it will only show route preview but won't start navigation.  I have spoken with many passengers and other drivers who have the same problems with the app, but I see all these glowing reviews and I have to assume half of them are Google employees. The app is terrible.  Really sad that I have to keep it installed on my phone.

author: Oliver1222
title: Distance measure
content:
Distance measuring feature could be useful, but could you make it so that I can just draw a path on the map instead of having to drop a pin and drag the whole map? It is kind of unintuitive and hard to use.
Also, it seems it trys by default to measure the distance to the pinned location from my current location, but this is really annoying when I am planning a trip abroad.

author: Hollowplayer
title: Avoid toll option disappeared after updated.
content: Avoid toll option disappeared after updated.

author: MomdeZack
title: Accurate and informative
content: A must when driving in a new area. Google maps has been my go to apps for years. I appreciate being able to locate nearby businesses wherever I am.

author: Suavirgo89
title: Why?!
content:
Why did Google have to make a feature where their traffic layer is automatically off and you have to manually turn it back on EVERY time the app is started? It was nice having the information readily available. It's not hands-free friendly having to divert attention from the road while driving to tap 2-3 times more to turn it on. EVERY time the app is started!
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÂõûÂ§çÔºöThank you for letting us know about this issue, and your patience as we fixed the problem. We appreciate it! With the latest update, Google Maps should now be working as usual.

author: Shirley/Sim
title: I Like It.
content: I have used different  map apps. Google Maps seems to load faster on my IPhone. I use Google Maps satellite display in my job as a truck driver when looking for a place I have never been before. It often saves me from having to find a place to turn my tractor-trailer around because I missed an obscure turn. Often when I request directions, I can scroll down and find alternate directions, such as to avoid a toll road.

author: ACO2005
title: Latest update is terrible
content:
Have to turn back on the traffic feature every single time that you close the app. and reopen it. Really inefficient, probably on safe.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÂõûÂ§çÔºöThank you for letting us know about this issue, and your patience as we fixed the problem. We appreciate it! With the latest update, Google Maps should now be working as usual.

author: Workday daily user
title: Unresponsive
content: It sure if its the app or my device, but I've noticed that when I use it and get out for whatever reason and then go back again, it will remain stuck and from where it was last and then after a couple of minutes, I get the error that says "unable to connect" and have to restart my device in order to get it to work again. This is so annoying!

author: The3rdshooter
title: Thanks for fixing Traffic Update
content:
Thanks for listening to complaints about Traffic option always defaulted to turned off. Reassuring to know that you actually try to fix these complaints. Good job. Also,  thank you very much for allowing us to delete search history more than one at a time. 
Yet, still not 100% 5 Star happy about how the Center-On button Automatically zooms in so much on your location. Especially after you got the map scaled to the size that you like to view traffic info and alternate routes, then refresh your location it automatically zooms in too much again, having to reset the desire map scale again and again.

author: The Sleeper awakes
title: Great assist for how to and traffic
content: I've been using Maps primarily on my cell phone. It's almost always used if I'm going anywhere more than a 20 minute trip. I may know the way but the the traffic assist is the real reason to keep it open. It hangs from the vent so it's always in view. It's also been great in unfamiliar locales especially for a long trip. We've followed its guidance when there is a major traffic slowdown. Sometimes it's a bit quirky the way it directs but we learn a new way to go somewhere.

author: bohemianrobot
title: Getting Better
content: Most of the unnecessary changes to Google Maps in the last year have been removed. It's great that the interface is all about efficiency again. Suggestions... Rid that annoying pop with the "You are on the fastest route" audio each and every time when utilizing turn by turn directions.  There needs to be an easier way to report incorrect directions. Doing so with the current options pertains more so to the specific details of a location. The road closure data needs more accuracy too. Apple Maps and Waze have up to date information, you'd think GM would as well.

author: Topper1995
title: This current version does not work for me at all.
content:
This current version no longer works. After latest update, all routes start either at work or at my home even though I have starting location to use current location. When starting my trip, app goes into "Rerouting" mode and never reroutes me, it locks up and I have to kill the app.  I can be 50 miles from home, pick end location down street and google creates route from my house. 

I have deleted app and reinstalled, checked location settings, etc. all started with last update. It seems "use current location" in my instance does not function anymore. I am guessing I will delete home and work address because google only uses those two locations for creating routes instead of current location. Feedback sent into google day app released with no feedback yet. 

Poor update.

I even reformat my phone and re upload the app and still would not doing anything.  It can not read my location to show me where I'm driving cause it keeping on spinning around.

title: One thing missing.
content: It is a great navigation tool. I wish you could select arrival time instead of just departure time. Please add that feature.

author: Mythrivgk
title: App abruptly ends when nearing the destination
content: I don't know if it's a bug or not, but I've faced this issue several times. When I am almost near to any destination, the map abruptly stops saying that I reached the destination way before I reach the actual destination. Sometimes the destination won't be anywhere in sight. It is very annoying in a busy traffic. I hope that next update will fix this problem. But apart from that, it is really a great app. Google maps has always been my first choice. Because of this one issue, sometimes I had to find other navigation apps.

Update: They fixed it. Changed to 5 stars.

content: Previous version was not happy because I had to always select traffic in order to see the traffic in real time. But now, its back everyone! The traffic is always on when you open the app. Thank you for putting it back Google!

author: Brian Meyette
title: Of no value; will not accept custom routing from PC
content: I use google maps on my PC to create custom routing between 2 points, rather than the 1-3 "suggested" routes.  I click on "send directions to your phone".  I get an email with a link in it.  If I click on that link on my PC, I get my custom route.   If I click on the emailed link in my iPad, all I get in this app is the 1-3 suggested routes.   Apparently the only thing that this app gets from the emailed link is the starting and ending points, then the app just gives the the standard canned routes.   That makes this app of zero value to me, as this feature is the only reason I got this app instead of using the Apple map app.

author: mcperry9970
title: Great Service for our Jeep Wrangler
content: Just would like to say a BIG Thank You to Landers McClarty in Huntsville Alabama for their outstanding service when our Jeep Wrangler was in for service on two different occasions within a month.  We received continual updates by phone and by text to keep us informed of the progress.  Even though the news was not always good during the course of these service events I was always notified and given best case options.  Derrick Smith was very concerned about us and our experience with their service department.  We purchased our Jeep there also.  We had a great buying experience as well and will definitely shop there again!  We appreciate everything you did for us Landers McClarty!

author: Sparkyboy71
title: Best navigation ever!!
content: Google maps has always been my go to app for all things map and traveling related. I do have a big complaint though that I think google should have added by now!!  Why is there no function for commercial traffic traveling. I live and work in New York and there are many times I'm in the work truck with commercial plates and we cannot travel on some roads bc they are "cars only" and sometimes I wanna find a route to get to a job and even though I choose the "avoid highways" option it still gives me roads that commercial vehicles cannot drive on. Google please add this function especially considering you guys have done so many incredible things with this app I'm surprised you have not added this option as of yet! Just make a "commercial route" option and it would make things so much easier for us working folks.

author: M3mph1sKyle
title: Must be a nice deal they have with toll companies
content:
Update! Be sure to check other routes carefully. The app will now ignore faster routes to direct you down toll roads. Sometimes it won't even show the faster route until you select "avoid tolls!" That's ridiculous, just because I'm willing to take tolls, does not mean I want to spend $10 on a slower route. 

I have also had the app redirect during the route (common) and just turn tolls right back on for no reason. This is super helpful when you don't know an area, lose perfect signal for half a second in downtown, then just follow the guidance out. By the time you're to the highway, the faster, non-toll route is now behind you bad would take much longer. I've paid closer attention and this is something that happens regularly. It doesn't happen every time the app tries to reroute for no reason, but just make sure to check your route after it does. 

Because this app seems to get off on making you take tolls. The 'remember settings' button won't remember to avoid tolls. Worse, even if YOU remember, there's a chance the app will reroute through tolls without your consent.

author: Searchguy2359
title: Great overall, issue with latest update
content:
I use this app almost every day. Overall it performs well. Latest update has issue with not remembering the traffic setting. Have to keep turning it on-- PITA!
There is also an issue of traffic colors being inconsistent at different zooms, as others have noted. That's probably more a back end issue, not the app, but can't say for sure.

author: F. Parsay
title: A Dynamic World View
content: Google Maps is an ever expanding world view and the expression of wholeness of life. It presents to us the multidimensional aspects of life and living including what we can do to enrich and to improve things at each corner of our planet. Google Maps has a comprehensive schematic of dynamics of life and an implicit and helpful dialogue with people through people. Google Maps is a discovery and learning tool and an innovative feature which will always be looking for and reaching out for perfection. An all time favorite application for all.

If you know how to use maps - this app is the best on the market as for me.

After the latest update, I have to activate the Traffic feature. Before, it stayed on after you selected it, and every time you opened the app, it was on. author: Big Easy MM Va
title: On Point
content: This app is awesome. I would get my directions so clearly that I didn't even have to think about whether or not I was going to miss the turns. It was like having a personal navigator...which I guess is the point! It even let me know about traffic delays in advance; and was within 2 minutes of how long they said the delay would be! Love this app

author: Lightly Salted
title: This version has VERY serious bugs
content: Just as Google improves the UI (and it has gotten a little better from the hot mess it used to be) they have introduced some extremely serious bugs. I have had multiple problems in the last week with very odd behavior including my home location suddenly shifting a mile down the road, very bizzare routing (trying to send me on a 45 minute route for a 10 minute trip) and a complete flake-out where the app suddenly thought I was driving in random directions a half mile off the interstate. In every case I had to swipe up on the app and restart to get it back into working mode. This is unusually buggy--even for a Google product--and could be dangerous in some circumstances.

author: GP|13
title: Constant unapproved route changes and no longer caching
content:
I'm on the road 8 months out of the year. Having a useful navigational app is key for the remote destinations I travel to in the US. When they released the 'offline maps' feature, I was absolutely thrilled and it worked great. Of course, this option is only available for the map view and not satellite view. This was unfortunate, but as long as I scrolled through the location in satellite mode, the app cached the images which worked ok. After the latest updates, the app no is longer caching satellite images which is a BIG disappointment. Why this app doesn't allow you to save satellite imagery for offline mode is beyond me.

Other annoying attributes to the app are constant route changes (not authorized by me), vocal updates you cannot mute unless ALL notifications are muted, and the 'You will arrive at 7:02PM' notification after starting your route. Hey developers, not everyone cares when they're going to arrive at their destination! There's already an ETA listed on the screen. I don't need the creepy vocals telling me the same info.

Lastly, as others pointed out, too many icons on the main screen.

author: Aduhuhduhh
title: Rerouting issue
content: I've been using this app for a while and maybe sometime the beginning of this year, all of the sudden it can't detect where I'm located exactly. For example: I exit off the freeway, and need to make a left or right, but it thinks I'm still on the freeway going straight so now I have to decide to go left or right and I'll either get lucky and make the right decision or I'll be lost because google maps can't detect where I'm at. This has happened to me too many times and could potentially cause an accident. I'm going to be using another app.

author: Double Eagle Eyes
title: Double Eagle Eyes
content: Came in for my follow up on my profess for my vision and it's more then what I expected. My vision is consider to be more then "Eagle Eye". The process for PRK took a little longer to recover but it's worth it! I would recommend to anyone that would consider getting it done.

author: Tricey81
title: Awesome Experience
content: Jayme is an awesome sales person at Reeds. She knew exactly what I was looking for without even knowing. Mind you I have walked in this store a hundred times not finding what I desired  and end up not purchasing anything and she's always was patient and kind. I was looking for something for my mother's anniversary death, a piece of jewelry that I can look at and remember the love between a mother and daughter never dies but live on FOREVER. As I waited for her awesome boss Jo-Jo cleaned my pandora bracelet I began to converse with Jayme. We discovered we had something in common, which is the worse type of pain one could ever endure, which is the loss of a mother. Jayme has lost both parents, and I will pray her strength continues. On the other hand. Jayme stated, "let me show you something, that I know your going to like." Mind you I didn't ask her anything but what I knew I already desired. It was two hearts that had "mother" and "daughter" on one side and "Your Are Always in My Heart" on the other side. PERFECT!!! Exactly what I been desiring for almost a year now. Nothing say something special when it have meaning. Her boss was just as awesome and helpful. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

author: dettifoss
title: I never use anything else
content:
I've never felt the need to use anything else. Google maps was revolutionary and continues to be so. 
I've experienced the odd glitch, like when I was in the U.K. and had the English Google lady and the American Google lady vying to give me directions the quickest, but nothing drastic. 
I've noticed the service in the U.K. has improved substantially, which is no mean feat given the higgledy piggledy road layout over there.

author: Metoo!!
title: Most of the time
content:
Most of the time, I'm happy. Occasionally it wants me to do absolute stupid routes, I just ignore as if it's a old relative, and we politely disagree.

The other day I did the update, and afterwards it thought we had moved to another state. I deleted and reloaded, and it was making sense again. 

But today, I was in a hurry and needed to use it on the go. I typed in the address skipping the direction indicator ex. 123 white st. It only said one direction, and I thought ok and selected it. Unfortunately, I found out rather quickly it wasn't the right one. That's when i had my biggest problem  with this app occur again. I just needed to change one letter in the address from south to north. Of course it took some fiddling with while I was at the stop lights, I was all set; and then it just changes it back to the prior address. ???? I had to go to safari to search for the new address and push directions from there. No problem??? No, PROBLEM!!! Wth 
But other than that I'm where I want to be with this app. Thanks.

title: Inconsistent and not updated roads
content: Google maps was my go to. I still use it for info as it is the best for information. But, shortcuts to home/work stopped working. Just thinks and spins. Can type it in but shortcuts don't work. Road closures are completely wrong for construction and send you out of your way. I keep reporting the road isn't closed and even though the road has been opened for months still shows closed. The problem is that is a great route home from work so now I can't check before to figure out what the best way to go is because google automatically disqualifies the route because of the closure. Apple maps and Waze are both updated and now I have to rely on them for nav.

author: DBnumberIV
