content:
The routes chosen always seem to wrong, making a detour over more direct route (miles out of the way), or changing where to go last minute.

I can't count home many times that it's has been correct (the answer is 0). People joke about Apple maps, but it has never lead me wrong.

author: Kat728472
title: Terrible
content: I was pretty much done with google maps when they got rid of the feature that allowed you to avoid tolls on iPhones. But today, I tried to use google maps to drive to work for the first time following the detour for the I-85 collapse in Atlanta. Google routed me off at the start of the detour to avoid a road closure, it said, and then immediately routed me back on 85. Onto a road that has been closed since the collapse. Newsflash google: 85 is closed for 3 miles and has been for 3 weeks. There is a Wikipedia article, you should look into it.

author: TRELWE

content: The app use to show red dots across the map that met your search criteria but they no longer show. The List Results are pointless compared to seeing everything on the map. Please fix this!

author: 0neoneone111
title: Google maps > apple maps
content: I've used both apple and google maps apps for years and google is the winner every time.

author: Altapetens
title: Best Nav App
content:
By far the best navigation app out there, and it's free!
I use it probably 10-20 times a day for navigation, trail finding, store/restaurant phone numbers, store hours, ratings, you name it. I'm also in construction and I use street view to see house that I've been asked to do proposals for. 
Incredible app, I don't know what I'd do without it.

author: traveling senior
title: Ruined unless you want Uber
content: This was a great app but now all I get for directions is Uber.  What a disaster!  Got to greedy Google!

author: Distressed gogo
title: Street view and my location is off
content:
I rely heavily on google maps to locate nearest restaurants, what the reviews say about a facility, what does the building look like so I don't pass it, or even how far away is my destination from my current location. I believe those are valid questions that google maps was created to answer. 

Ever since the last update, my 'Current Location' is off by a street or two and sometimes (if I'm lucky) a few houses off. Then when I'm looking for a store (Starbucks for example), I'm trying to find a certain landmark (like is this in a strip mall? If so, what are the stores by it so I don't miss the turn to get in there) on the app and the picture of the store, from different area of the city, are all the same. 

I live in a city and I use Verizon--so my connection is pretty stellar. So why is this app telling me that it has a connection error and to check my network? 

I'm beyond frustrated! For a company that specializes in technology, I'm fairly disappointed. However, it is still better than the iPhone maps--please fix and I'll rate it differently.

author: Edit Dude
title: Street View new navigation concept flawed, also major SV bug on iPad
content:
Hate the new navigation of street view. I constantly end up moving when I'm trying to pan/scroll around to view, and I usually don't ever want to have my view auto drift to the direction of travel while moving. Usually we want to remain looking sideways or behind while traveling.

Also, new recent bug only on iPad‚Äîthe app locks on a white screen when I enter street view. Access to street view is restored when I close and reopen the app. But when I leave street view, the app locks again on the map screen until I exit and return to the app.

author: Sunny Lang

author: Emperor Wabbitt
title: MRES is Awesome!

I have used Tony Markarian at MRES for two refinances of my home and I couldn't be happier with my experience.  Tony and his assistant, Kelli, are experienced, knowledgeable, and personable.  On top of that, they are honest and will steer you in the right direction.  They will do what's right for you.  I will go back to Tony for any of my future real estate finance needs.
William Rauch
Chatsworth, CA.

author: MDahlberg

content: Your latest update just broke the app!  When I put in a previous search, the app says that I'm already at my location as soon as I hit start.  I love this app normally.  I use it extensively when traveling for both business and pleasure.  Please roll back to the previous version.  In the meantime, I'll turn off auto updates (if able).

author: CheazBomb
title: When incompetence becomes dangerous!
content: I don't normally leave reviews, but when incompetence rises to such a level as to be dangerous, I feel like I need to say something. I tried to use Google maps to find an address today. The website allowed me to put in the address, but then refused to do anything until I downloaded the app, essentially tricking/forcing me to do so. I couldn't help but wonder what would have happened if I had been driving. After being forced to download the app, I opened it assuming I would finally get directions for the address I had typed into the website. However, the system just continued in a loop with the website sending me back to the app, and strangely, the app sending me back to the website where I had typed in the directions. I was driving by this time, so it was dangerous for me to be messing with my phone. I never did get it to work, and as a result, my children missed an Easter egg hunt. I guess I should count my blessings that this was the only consequence, as opposed to a potentially serious traffic accident caused by struggling with google's incompetence.

author: Watchmewithlove
title: WHAT HAPPENED? Use to be good!
content:
Google maps has got to be one of the worst apps ever. It used to be amazing. Now it is slowly getting worse. I'm constantly being lost for things that are 10 minutes away. I am constantly rerouted. Please do something about this. I have pictures to show this. What happened when it was 

The directions go completely block, it constantly vibrates for no reason to. PLEASE FIX!!

Hope in the future, we'll have live traffic and routes will update based on the traffic.

Most of the addresses are incorrect. The number of the houses are incorrect too. Fix it. There wasnt such problem 2-3 years ago. I dont freaking know what kind of "bug fixes" you update in the app, just make sure the app is working properly and dont act like retards.

author: Sparkie480
title: Please prioritize updates for drivers
content:
Overall all I still really really like this app a lot but... I wish you would make it a priority to make this app least distracting to use for those of us who are operating vehicles on the road.  Specially, it would be deeply appreciated if your updates made your most commonly used traffic features are easy to see and access without needing to go into menus.

So my little complaint is about easy-to-see.  The favorites used to be much easier to see at a glance.  In the previous version the favorites icons were simple stars surrounded by a black border.  I know the new paradigm seems to be borderless imagery but now my favorites just tend to blend in with everything else when I zoom in.  Being able to spot them quickly is why I took the time to mark them on the map in the first place.

Thumbs up, Google. Bravo!

author: Joe Buttlicker
title: New version is bad
content: Satellite view doesn't work anymore and even the default view is slow & laggy to load.

author: nmdunn
title: One of the best GPS apps available
content:
Google Maps is one of the best GPS apps available (the other one is Waze). 

GM is very easy to use, has good navigation features, and excellent voice directions. 

Two improvements I'd like to see:
1. Night mode - the current color scheme doesn't work well for me, especially the route highlighting. The blue against the dark background doesn't provide enough contrast. I'd like to see something brighter, or the option to choose your own color scheme. 

2. "Always On" mode - I'd like to use GM while driving as a reference tool without needing point-to-point instructions. If you're not using the routing feature, the app will shut off after a short time, probably to save battery life. But there are times when I want to drive with a map view open so I can learn the surrounding area, alternate routes, etc.

author: bentleywg
title: Older version was much better
content: Please bring back the ability to swipe to see the next turn. I use this all the time. Also, the new static previews are too small, they don't have map context, and they don't stick to north-pointing. By taking all this away, you took away half the functionality, so I'm taking away two stars. I'm reluctantly hunting for a new map directions app now.

author: Elduderino 123
title: Awful.
content: This is literally the worst navigation app I've ever used. Got lost 5 times and rerouted countless times because it did not recognise that we were on the correct route. It also zooms out when you're supposed to make a turn of merge off of a road and makes it impossible to tell if you are taking the correct exit. I can't express how upset I am with this app. Absolutely a terrible navigation tool. I would continue to write horrible things but it is just not worth it.

author: JadeJen√©
title: Trash
content: Google maps for Apple is extremely faulty and inconvenient. Road closures aren't reported promptly, it typically takes forever to collaborate correctly, and if you need walking directions, forget it! I'd suggest waze for those who may share my same frustrations with the app. Waze doesn't have walking navigation but for day to day driving directions and shorter routes they're the way to go.

author: BrandoJ495
title: Broken
content: Satellite view does not work after update.

author: Kaitlyn Coyne
title: Terrible for cyclists
content: Due to the construction happening in Boston, I've had to start bicycling for work. Normally I don't write reviews, but google maps has been so terrible it was impossible for me not to write one. It doesn't update for road/ bridge closures, and tries to tell you to go through routes that are closed off. Especially if you are just listening through a headphone and have your phone in a backpack or bag, google maps doesn't give you much time to know when you'll have to cut across three lanes of Boston traffic to make a turn.

author: Haenisch024
title: Need My Maps
content: Using recent iOS in iPhone 6 with most recent version of google maps. When I'm driving the direction the app thinks I'm going changes mid trip. This causes the app to think I'm going in a direction that I'm actually not going and it reroutes. But I'm not actually going the wrong direction so this is super annoying while driving because the app rerouted in a direction that isn't relevant. Ex, I was driving north tonight, the app for some reason thought I turned around south and rerouted. But I hadn't deviated course at all. I've been using google maps for several years and have never had any type of issue like this and now have had several instances recently where the app seems to lose the direction I'm traveling and rerouted. This is really annoying! Please fix. Happy to provide more info if it helps.

This feature can be accomplished by making so that you can press, hold, and drag the blue route to any highway.

author: Jehivgu
title: Caused a car accident
content: Tonight I used Google Maps instead of Waze or my cars navigation system which I normally use and it directed me to take a different route than usual. This route had me cross four lanes of traffic and I was t-boned. I should have never listened to Google maps and followed this unusual and dangerous path across heavy traffic!! I will be deleting this useless app after this review. Please be very careful about following Google!

author: Zildjiancat
title: Pac-Man?
content: So now there's yet a third icon on Google Maps? And this one serves no discernible purpose at all. It's Pac-Man so you can play a game instead of actually use Google Maps to get directions to go somewhere. When are IT people going to grow up and realize working for a living is serious business? The screens on most cell phones are small, and that's more apparent when viewing a map. And now more map space is taken up with a silly game icon. Please allow users to be able to eliminate/hide the stupid thing. It shouldn't be on the app in the first place. Not because the game wouldn't be fun, but it's in the way and the app is no place for it.

author: Caroline Gorodn
title: Ruined the directions menu!
content: Now that clicking on the bottom bar brings up menu options instead of just the list directions has ruined the UX. It has not only made it inconvenient to look at them but also slightly dangerous because it makes me look at my phone longer while on the road. The only reason I'm giving it a 3 not a 1 is because the rest of the app is fine.

author: Nekharpa
title: Most frustrating updates!
content: Every time they update, things get tougher to use!  NOW they want me to sign in nearly every time I use the blasted thing in order to access all of my saved and labeled places!  That's not a possibility when I'm lost and on the highway going 65 mph!  One of the previous updates kept taking me out of car mode and putting me into their new Uber mode. Took 20 min researching the issue in the Internet to find out what was going on. Now I see they've changed that icon once again. Google: just let me keep my options!  Don't keep changing things without any choice on my part!

author: Sam98553
title: Horrible
content: Where is the preview route button? Why there is no longer the ETAs for multiple stops? I don't know Google is listening at all. I've reached out to them about this issue and they still haven't responded to me....

author: serenissim7
title: Form over function
content: The feature to view directions in a list has been replaced with a pointless drop down menu that adds unnecessary steps. Please change it back!

author: Sgt.P
title: What happened to iWatch support?
content:
This is the only app I can find that has reliable bike routes. It was so helpful to be able to ride and see upcoming directions using my iWatch. Because Apple Maps doesn't offer bike directions, I'll stick to using this app but I'm certainly less of a promoter now. 

On a positive note, I really enjoy the newer version of "my places". I just moved to a new city and it's great for keeping a list of places I want to try. I wish that feature worked better with the desktop version of Google Maps. It's great!

author: HelenNJ
title: Bad UI decisions
content: Who designs UI like this? Useless "explore food" bar and constantly switching elements. Spent like half an hour to find a button to switch from the satellite to map view. Turns out the button is placed like in the middle of nowhere (at least on ipad). Stop messing around and instead make changes that actually add value, like better directions. Even online version is better than this piece of work.

author: Isaacsac
title: I have lost the Google Maps Apple Watch app
content: When I recently updated the Google Maps app. I noticed that my Apple Watch does not have the Google Maps app anymore. Please bring it back. Please.

author: Joneleth
title: Best mapping app
content:
I wish I could somehow silence voice navigation without turning it off. I listen to music/podcasts from my phone in my car and often I find this app talking over things when I don't need/want it to. But also, if I am using this for navigation, I don't want the whole trip's directions silent. I really need a top-level mute button that I can toggle without diving into complex menus while driving.

Also, asking for my opinion on a place 5 minutes after I've arrived is annoying and pointless. I don't know how a restaurant is that I'm still waiting for a table at. You have my GPS data, so ask me right after you detect me leaving.

Lastly, there's been more than a few times where the app has directed me to go a sub-optimal route when another clearly better one exists. I understand that, but when I ignore the directions, go the better route, and make way better time in fewer turns within less miles... it would be nice if the app would take note and remember that for next time (even if just locally for me).

All that said, this is still the best navigation app ever.

author: positiveg

Love the fact that even here it shows up places of interest and I'm able to contribute to the community and give updates in places of interest. 
Keep up the good works guys.

author: Raym no2
title: Almost a 5
content: I think the title tells it all. Lacking is the ability to get longitude and latitude for when driving in the country, and setting parking locations quickly. Finally, some of the best features are not as intuitive as some other offerings but it is usually in there some place. But, there are some neat features you cannot find in other packages. Best of all it gives you choices of routes and has never given bad directions or left me stranded. And google is improving the software all the time. Of the three packages I have in my phone this is my go to navigation app.

author: Taffyinpa

content: Makes it easy to find where I want to go

author: metro9965

content: Why would they make everything that was a one click action, and turn it into two???

author: EsteCon
title: Google, why did you ruin it?
content:
I love Google maps.  Wayyyyy better than iPad maps. Glad they finally made it available for the iPad. Traffic is so much easier to see over iPad maps but a recent update changed the default traffic setting to always off.  I really like opening the app and having the traffic already displayed. Now I have to touch the layers button and turn on traffic every time I open the app. This is very annoying.
 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

author: California_Boy01

content: This app makes you take the longest turns just to get to your destination. It's not fast enough to tell you hey make sure you turn left in the next mile without having to be on the app itself. Horrible!

author: Ategev
title: 3D Touch Doesn't Work When Not in Ram
content: What happened?

author: I'm Billy
title: I have a suggestion
content: Thank you for making the option for remembering the route settings like avoiding tolls, but can you make it work please? I'm having an issue where even though I check the box, it doesn't remember to avoid tolls. When you're on the road and have to input directions on the fly, it erases the setting and I ended up on the toll road. I would have just re-routed myself to avoid it, but I had just spent a week with a bunch of crabby teenagers and wanted to get home. Re-routing would have added 45 min to the trip that I didn't want to spend in a van with those people. Please fix this issue and make it permanently remember the settings.

author: Frugal17372
title: Used to be awesome.....
content:
This latest version no longer allows the "show traffic" button to stay on after closing and reopening app. I used this app everyday to scout traffic and now I have to turn traffic on every single time I open the app. Who's genius idea was that? #FAIL!

Also, newest version now has me click the microphone button twice to get voice search to work. After clicking the first time, it tells me I need to enable the microphone in settings/privacy. It is already enabled there. I've even tried to toggle in on and off, but it still makes me click the microphone twice. Very frustrating!!!!!!! Fix this!!!!!!

author: Kenichiro Suga
title: Great navigation... if only...
content:
My iPhone allows me to navigate without internet nor downloading a map.  
If only Google could do the same.  
When I go from country to country, I use my iPhone for navigation. It is not very accurate, but it has been accurate enough to get me home.

author: Brandonr91
title: Needs major missing features.
content: It works as intended and does it well on the iPhone. Would like to see features like use side streets, alleys and dirt roads. Though, would like to see Parking location services added & other features like nearest parking locations. Finally it'd be nice to have multi-stop abilities - equoped with ootimal route in the midst of a multi-desrination trip with things like place priority and or manual manipilation of destinations and their orders so that of mistakes are made and or plans change then one could make the needed adjustments without having to start from scratch. Finally it'd.be fantastic to do all this via voice, too.

author: Warfare guy
title: Killed my phone
content: Brought in an otherwise fully functional phone to replace the ear speaker (it worked on speakerphone). The phone died on their bench but they refuse to take responsibility. Avoid.

author: Jacob McElyea
title: Still mediocre
content: I wish Google Maps would include speed limits on roads, especially major highways. Also Apple Maps has included a reminder of where you are parked, and that should be included as well, especially if you've parked in a large parking lot.

author: Parker Knight
title: Average User
content:
I drive in my Mini Cooper. I can drive around just fine. 

If you are a truck driver and use satellite images, go there in your small car before delivery to find exactly where to deliver the truck with and route before taking a huge truck there and don't rely entirely on the satellite images. And, on top of that giving this awesome app only one star for which you don't pay satellite imaging service for.

author: hananhm
title: Current location broken ?
content:
Every time I try to get directions somewhere it shows my 'your location' as the same wrong location but the my location button still works
 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

author: Jenkitty3
title: Needs an update
content: I have been using Google maps for years now over the Apple maps. Within the last few weeks the Google maps doesn't move with my cars direction, turns me around in the wrong direction or just doesn't work. When you don't know where you are going and then your Google Maps doesn't work, that's a big issue. I will be using Apple Maps until you fix your app.

author: Christopher Murray
title: Where's the new feature to follow friends?
content:
This week, technology sites announced that Google Maps was releasing (this week) a new feature to follow your friends within the app.  
Was the feature supposed to be seen with this recent update, because if it was, I certainly don't see it.  Or will be it provided in another update this week?  Or perhaps pushed via server side?

author: Skadood1
title: Still preferred over Apple maps
content:
Update:
Boo! Latest version they rearranged half the UI; the satellite vs terrain layers are more difficult to choose because they have a tiny new button and when you click to select one you've got to click once again to get back to the map. It's also very hard to turn on/off satellite view when directions are going - they had recently made it easy and now again its in deeper settings.

Former Review:
More data on their maps, more precise, small stores, malls, terrain, etc. Googles driving directions have lane data, which is unique, but it has timing issues on when it tells you about turns. 93% to perfection.

author: 737 max
title: Best navigation
content: Best navigation by far. It gives so much details, l had use all kinds gps but none like this. Only down side is drains battery.

author: SamYahm
title: One of the Best
content: One of my favorite Apps. Great.

author: whiskynovember
title: Yet another update & still no speedometer. Sad.
content: Please!

author: MV Dave
title: Used to Love It
content: The app suddenly started putting a large Pacman(?) icon on the screen making it extremely distracting and hard to use in the car as it's too easy to hit by accident. Once there is a means to suppress the icon from showing up on the screen, I would be happy to return to five stars. Until then, I'm going to have to use Apple Maps. Too bad, because I've been using this for years and now I have to learn the look and feel of another one.

author: Bills J.
title: Hands down the best map app
content: I have used many different maps throughout my life this one is by far the best the easiest to search for easiest to navigate and utilize always updated smoothest and most reliable. Am I missing anything?

author: Gaypanda üëåüêº
title: Love this app but...
content:
I use this app just about everywhere I go whether I'm taking the train, driving by car or riding my bike. It really gets you where you want to go but recently I've been working with commercial vehicles and I see that it doesn't have an option for routes for these vehicles. 

I really think google maps should work out an option to say whether you are commuting via regular commute or commercial commute that way you know which parkways to stay off of with a commercial vehicle if you were driving via that kind of transportation. 

I hope Google maps see this and can work to provide this option. Thank you

author: RnBSoul
title: Worse with every update!
content: Congratulations on making this app even worse!  Didn't think you could do it but you have. Ms. PAC-MAN really??  Why would I want that on my navigation app?  Are you really that stupid?  Also thanks for the non-stop ride share ad pop ups!  Like I need that 50 times a day!  What happened google?  Now Apple Maps looks enticing for once. Hope they pay you good for steering people to their maps app.

title: Last two updates bugged
content:
Last two versions have a bug where "current location" doesn't reflect the GPS location (which is working fine!) Then it locks up trying to reroute! App is mostly unusable right now.

author: hairbrainer
title: Stress free travel to new places
content: Easy to use.  Never feel lost again.

author: Delohc
title: Pok√©mon Go??
content: Google Maps was one of my "Go Too" apps when I was looking for direction, or places. It was indispensable. But since google maps found it necessary to add "Pok√©mon Go" to their app it's been a pain. You sure don't want to accidentally hit that icon because the game will pop up. I've tried removing it from the app (per instructions on the web) but that didn't do it. So, I've deleted the app. Too bad too, because it was a great maps app !!!  Wake up google, not everyone wants to play games when using your app.

author: Astheworldturns2
title: Latest update gives wrong verbal commands
content: Was using maps in Orlando Florida today and the verbal directions were telling me left when the map correctly said turn right. Fix!!!

author: Linda Claudine
title: Why Can't u Get Along??
content: We all have to use both Apple and Google apps - why make it so difficult? For what I spend on electronics and apps, I should not be part of this ridiculous war. Set an example and just maybe our government will follow. Most of us want to get along and want what is best for us all - that's called compromise. In case you aren't paying attention - there is revolution brewing everywhere; and our youth who are very technologically savvy, and more often than not don't worship the all mighty corporate dollar. I have no doubt that the "Millennials" or whatever the following group (if we still have a world) is called will come up with solutions that will make your ludicrous Apple/Google war unimportant. Are short term profits that important to y'all? You either get it or you don't. Laws against using our phones actively while driving are in place in many - and soon most - states. If you're not part of the solution - you guessed it: you're part of the problem.

author: LaughLivLuv
title: BEST GPS NAVIGATOR EVER
content: This Google app is my favorite most used app. I use it everyday every time I'm driving or riding anywhere I go. It will let me know if there is a wreck, traffic & if it's mild, moderate or heavy. I can put in a route and then add a stop. If my husband and I are traveling and we are looking for a certain store (for example Walmart) then I will add a stop, type in Walmart and it will show all the Walmart's on our route and it tells me how many minutes it adds to our drive. This app has saved my husband & I so much time in our lives. I've used all kinds of GPS navigation systems and this one is by far the best!!! Every time it is updated it gets even better!! It's a must have app!!!!

author: VelcroP
title: Distracting ads
content: Now when I open, an ad for a video game blocks the bottom 25% of the screen, and amongst the on screen buttons is one that leads to that game.  I use this app while I'm driving and need to be able to quickly glance to keep my eyes on the road.  The color scheme and size are too distracting.  No option to 'upgrade' to remove ads. Not that I would, since the other maps type apps are free.

author: marcus.lzy
title: Could you add an orientation-lock option?
content: Everytime I use the google maps to navigate I have to swipe up and down several times in order to use the iOS control center to lock the screen orientation for a consistent vertical navigation interface. If it is during driving I could hardly manage to do that.  Could you please add an option that allow users to always lock the navigation interface to be vertical?

author: infamousree
title: No more traffic default?!?  WHY???
content: I've been a loyal Google Maps user for years.  It's the best map for traffic out there, until recently.  With whatever update, you guys removed the default to traffic option.  We now have to toggle traffic on each time we open the app üòñ Since I'd think most people use your app FOR ACTUAL TRAFFIC when commuting or directions...this change is a huge misstep. It's one thing to take it away, then have an option to turn it on in settings...but that's not even there.  Please change it back or give us an option.  Thank you!

author: Suni-Magar
title: The best navigation app
content:
I love that it gives you not just the driving instructions, but also the opening hours and online reviews of different places/stores! It's handy especially if you're going to a new location for the first time, and you don't know its opening hours. Instead of googling for it, just open your Google Maps app, type in the location, and drive to your destination if it's open! 

Another really useful feature of the walk route option! I've used Google Maps to lead me to a specific spot within a shopping area before. üòÖ

Sorry, Apple, but I prefer Google Maps.

author: Double clutchin
title: Not bad
content: Simple gps does not show many options if you decide to take side streets you may want to turn off voice because it will never understand that some people use it to avoid traffic not to find their way home. Google maps is a decent gps that is reliable nothing more.

author: CharlesLM
title: Drop a pin navigation does not work
content:
Hold your finger down to drop a pin. Gives the coordinates. Next press navigate and go. GPS will randomly recalculate. Little did I know it changes the destination. I have not found a reason. It usually picks areas in the same city and will bring me to a random business.

I find this very frustrating. I work in a busy multi-county ambulance service. I need to pin ambulance bays, special entrances, etc. I cannot do that since the pinning feature does not work. I can label and save it but rarely will it ever keep my actual destination. Please fix!

When I start navigation, maps starts re-calculating the route, but doesn't finish (I have killed the app after some minutes). Very frustrating experience due to my heavy reliance on the app, please fix the bug asap. Thank you!

Since the last update however they have added advertisements for games which is incredibly dangerous while driving. The boxes come up and cover a good portion of the screen and it is easy to accidentally touch it which causes another window to pop up. Please be rid of this hazard Google maps!!

author: thesuperalice
title: Ads or a Virus?
content:
Did Google Maps suddenly start using ads, or did I somehow get a virus that makes Ms PacMan pop up all over my screen? And if they've started using ads, why haven't they released a paid version that's ad-free?

SMH. Other than that, I like the app and use it all the time. Until the ads--now I might look for something else.

author: SmileyoneinMN
title: Bring Back Constant Traffic Layer
content: Google Maps is my go-to navigation but like many other reviewers I am frustrated with the latest update that has removed the ability to have traffic always showing. It is now a manual process every time. Not good to have to mess with when I'm driving. Please fix this.

author: wb9zqu
title: Get rid of Pac Man
content: Get rid or make a way to turn off the stupid PAC Man stuff. There is already not enough screen space to have a stupid game with  important directions needed and if your not careful, you will start it to playing while you are using the app trying to get information on directions. I will go back to Apple Maps until google make a way to get rid of this stupid feature.

author: rmbeur
title: Upside down
content: Wish there was support to turn iPhone upside down so I could charge while using app...

author: Oc, ca
title: Avoid tolls by default
content:
There isn't a general setting for avoiding tolls. I have to check every trip to make sure the direction it's not using toll roads.

Apple Maps implemented this feature correctly. If you're not sure how such feature works, I recommend launching the Maps app. This wonderful app exists for a while now. It's one of the default apps that pre-installed on iPhone. If your development team doesn't have an iPhone, just borrow one from someone. There a a lot of people using them. It's one of the best feature from Maps, but I have confidence in your dev team that you guys can replicate the feature. Please check it out.

Once it's install, goto the settings and turn on avoid tolls. That's it. You'll never have to worry it again. It remembers your preference and automatically avoid tolls by default. Isn't that amazing? Go check it out.

author: Vikki-V. 626
title: Favorite App to use for a lot of things
content:
I love this app. I use it when I need a phone number of a place, the hours of a business, saving my parking spot, saving new fun places I've found, so much more. 

Much better than the google maps iPhone has preprogrammed into the phones

author: kbn9
title: Getting worse
content: This app used to be a really good app, but for some reasons, it has been getting worse. It doesnt provide direction as quick as it used to. It doesnt update the road as well as it used to. For example, it cant give me the new directions when the street is under construction. I have gotten lost a few times because the app could not update the streets. Disappointing.

author: sciencedriven
title: A teeny bit of human curation in NYC, please?
content:
The past few weeks have seen a significant uptick in loop-de-loop navigational "guidance", and voice cues that are not in sync with the visual maps.
Today, I didn't really need to go through the Holland Tunnel, make a u-turn, pay $15, and drive back again. Doing a 10min drive in lower Manhattan from one errand to another would have been fine, thank you.

Is this deep learning without a framework, yet again?

author: Bigtmize
title: Duh
content: You have taken such a wonderfully simple app and morphed it into something so incredibly complicated that is absolutely worthless. Thx!

author: ihashedgie
title: What happened
content: I love this app as a map and it always works and is fairly accurate with timing. I was delighted at the Little Miss pacman update. Except when I finish the game my pacman button disappeared. Was that supposed to happen? If so can we bring her back? I've seen a couple reviews saying they don't like it so but maybe we can put it as a feature that you can turn on and off. I personally think that it added a cute fun little game to a otherwise more boring map.

author: truckermouth
title: Why hide route overview and search in a menu
content: Hate that the new update put 'Route Overview' and 'Search' in a menu when in turn-by-turn directions mode. Makes no sense. Put it on the main screen again.

author: sdub206
title: Bring Back Route Preview!!! Almost crashed my car!
content: Seriously, route preview was OPTIMAL when you could get there in one click. I almost rear ended an SUV this morning trying to get to the route preview option! WTH, Google?!?!

author: Effing Cheesetree
title: Good map
content: The app is great, always does what it says it will do. My only negatives are; 1- it can be very difficult to maneuver, a better menus would be great and 2- my saved maps are not accessible offline. So the app is great for navigating as long as it can find a signal but if you lose the signal on a road trip you lose your map.

author: Desert_Photos
title: Terrific app. I use it several times every day.
content: The transit information is very accurate and detailed. For the next 6 weeks I'm living in another city in California where I have to use the bus. The day after I got here I found that Google Maps, Transit, had already determined my location and is now showing the bus stops and times in my neighborhood. This app just keeps getting better. Way better than Apple's Map.

author: Whateveropolis
title: Artificially limits functionality
content: Using 3D Touch to navigate to Home/Work requires enabling Web History. That's unnecessary and silly.

author: Customer assistance
title: Life Storage
content: Life Storage on a Memorial Parkway SW in Huntsville, AL has a great Asst. Mgr.  Dave was so helpful to us.  He did not have a climate-controlled 5x10 unit available, but helped us find a unit nearby.  He also pointed out the best buys on tape, paper, and boxes.  We bought our supplies there and will be back when we need more!

author: Cheapskate01
title: Still crashes on latest version of iPad Pro
content:
I got my new iPad Pro about three updates ago and the first thing I noted was that Google Maps crashes when trying to use Street View.  This crash is on my iPad Pro only; works on all my other Apple devices.  My wife has last year's iPad Pro; no problem there, either.

But I am very frustrated that this is the third update since I got my iPad Pro and this serious bug has not been fixed.

Maybe there's not a lot of NEW iPad Pro users out there.

Dear Google:  Please contact me that I can explain this bug to you!

author: EvCC_04_02
title: Dubai Map needs update
content: The map in Dubai is not accurate at all.

author: ElburnGirl
title: Push a lot of buttons to navigate.
content:
Google maps is so not user friendly and this last update causes the Voice Search  microphone not to recognize that I've authorized the private settings to use Voice Search. So if I tap it again, it realizes that my private settings have authorize the microphone. It's an irritating bug. I don't like it when you need to change your destination and have to push 4 exit buttons to go back to the home page. It is so needless. How about this?...
~Exit directions?
~Exit Destination?
~New destination?
~Add a destination to my current route?
It is soooooo tedious! 
IT IS NOT HANDS FREE FRIENDLY!
Why does it have to be sooo needy. You cannot move to a new route with your finger like the old days.
Terrible app, but TomTom is worse.

author: Rudy ca
title: Benchmark for Maps
content: Google maps is absolutely the world benchmark for a mapping app. The only reason why I don't give it five stars is because an improved zooming feature need to be developed. Especially the ability to zoom out to see traffic 5-10 miles ahead.

author: 580HexShank
title: gets better
content: all the time. Five stars earned.

author: Naninara
title: Maps in Apple Watch
content: The google maps in Apple Watch was good but could not see the actual maps and there was no sound or haptic vibrations in the watch. These were the drawbacks for the application, it would be great if there were the actual map shown on the watch with speaking directions. I would be driving 10 hours daily. So this would be more helpful. I have given four stars as I like using google maps in my phone. Hope you guys update the Watch application.

author: Super Snarfer
title: Fade To Black - Worse Than Ever
content:
Updated review:

I use this app for street view to help me preview where I'm driving to get the lay of the land. At least, I used to because it no longer works. Street view keeps going black every time I try to use it. And those horrible blue lines just don't help to move the street view. 

In short, the app no longer works for what I need it to do. It's been that way for a long time now through numerous updates. And if it's possible, the problems just got worse with today's update of May 11, 2017. If I could give zero stars, I would.

Maybe if Google cared a little more about putting out a quality product and a little less about spying on us through data collection (see the reviews of the spyware known as Waze), they'd resolve these issues. But I'm not holding my breath.

author: Vercetti27
title: Annoying bug
content:
(On my iPhone 5s)
Whenever you close the app, then open it and click the microphone icon for a voice search, there's always a prompt to allow microphone access via privacy settings ....even with access already granted.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÂõûÂ§çÔºöThank you for letting us know about this issue, and your patience as we fixed the problem. We appreciate it! With the latest update, Google Maps should now be working as usual.

author: GinoTheGreat
title: Best maps of all
content: I tried few of them, but accuracy and versatility couldn't be better than Google maps. Yes, here and there, they have some issues, but over all, they are the best maps on market today. I use them on my bicycle runs, my hiking, my car driving, etc. They simply were unreplacable by others and they are free to use it as much as you want! You go Google!!!

author: TheLittle_Prince
title: Must have App !!!
content: The best app when you travel abroad!! I have a great experience using google maps while traveling alone, discovering new places and enjoying !!

author: Sanjay_Nambiar
title: Works great
content: Very reliable even in rural and remote India. I've used it in many parts of Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Kerala and Andra. The talk back which reads out directions can go whacky sometimes. But not too often. This can also be because, in India, when businesses drop a pin to indicate a location, they do a vague approximation, not ensuring it falls on the correct side of a road or intersection. So the app makes you do turns and u-turns and when you get there, the business isn't there and we get baffled. But that isn't the app's fault.

author: kf6dky
title: Still good but still lacking...
content:
... something. I'd like to see it slightly better featured. Smaller navigation header and control over the user experience. Easier use of map while in motion without competing against its auto zoom feature. Would like to see  app swap button for programs which use it often such as the lyft. It seem the top blue bar takes up much screen real estate. 
Otherwise it's really good and I highly recommend it.

author: Mit4
title: Disappointing update
content:
Used to work fine. Now when I touch the microphone I get a message saying that I have to change it in my settings. When I go to my settings, it's already on. If I wait, my microphone eventually works. What a hassle!

Another issue that I know have that it tells me to go one way. When I do, it starts to tell me that I need to go another way like its rerouting me. The. It rerouted again to the first way. It's very confusing and frustrating while I'm driving.

author: TooTallRunsWithScissors
title: PAC-Man?
content: Seriously?  Why can't you give us an option to remove this useless feature.  I use google maps in all seriousness for work functions.  Maybe I should just go over to Apple Maps and start using them as others have also mentioned doing.  It's annoying just looking at the icon sitting on the map.  It's clutter.  Give us the option to remove it please!

author: Ahahgagakdfkkdkdjs
title: This app needs drastic improvement
content: Literally you make me wish I had my ancient tomtom again. This app is so unhelpful. I just spent 35 minutes trying to get to my destination when it was supposed to take 13. Thanks for not telling me explicitly to get in the cars and trucks lane instead of the cars lane. How was I supposed to know exit 13A isn't accessible from the cars lane??? You should always allow me to see the direction following the current direction, in case the system is running super slow, as it always does somehow, and I miss my turn or exit. Thanks. Hoping your next update is actually helpful instead of backwards like they have been lately.

author: tsykal
title: Overview button
content:
Overview button is not responsive most of the time (when in drive mode and want to zoom out to see the entire path from departure to destination).
Also, when I am in overview mode, and I want to switch between the possible routes why in the world do you put me into the drive mode automatically????
This is so inconvenient especially because switching between the road is extremely unreliable and when I'm am put into the drive mode I have no idea which route it picked.

author: Crawfyi
title: Pretty Much Perfect
content: If you're between using the iPhone's built in map app or Google maps, go for the latter. They both offer just about the same features but I haven't been able to find route options like 'avoiding highways' in Apple Maps.

author: Bobby Crash
title: Still Behind The Times
content:
Google maps continue to drive you ways the hell out of the way to make a turn around (for an opposite direction) instead telling you to turn around now! Totally stupid!!! Idiots!! 
(Check out apple maps) if you need to go in opposite direction, Apple informs you immediately (so you can make the decision to turn around wherever you'd like) google maps takes you on a epic safari instead of saying "turn around" "make a u turn". 
Really???

author: Gwonder
title: App stops while driving!
content:
Each "update" of this app has gotten worse. I was on an hour long trip and it stopped the navigation twice each way. That's a pretty dangerous issues, especially if one is driving alone. 

Update on September 16: 
This app is still pretty bad. It's great to add new features, but my primary issue is with the navigation system, which continues to stop after a certain period of driving. Perhaps I'm the only one with this issue since google continue to rank very well. However, I would hope that this is somehow addressed and acknowledged.

author: Jer291114
title: Traffic setting doesn't stay on
content:
All other versions of Google maps allowed you to turn the traffic option on and even if you shut your phone off the next time you open the map it was on and ready. Now you have to put it in every time.
 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

author: Karl-Thomas
title: Preview route now 2-step process
content: A bad design change in this update. Now to preview a route you can no longer tap once in the little arrow icons. You have to tap to open a menu and tap again in a different location to preview the route mid travel.

author: Gregcheersykes
title: Great.
content:
Always a step ahead of Apple Maps and more accurate!  

Really and that comes from an Apple fanboy!!!

author: Average "Joe"
title: Um, Ms. PAC Man??!?
content:
Just updated the app and now there is a Ms. Pac Man icon universe the locator screen. The heck?? Not only did this come out of left field but has no relevance to maps and directions whatsoever.  No indication is was even going to be part of an update from what I can tell or what it's purpose is besides wasting data and serving to be a colossal waste of time and space. 

Please remove it. Period.

 If I want to play Pac Man games on my phone I'll download an app for it. Don't put a game in an app I actually use daily.

author: Dgarmush
title: Very stupid map application
content: On the April 1 it displays Pok√©mon circle next to directions and your location button. This caused so much distraction and once clicked on by accident it takes you to another page, this almost caused me twice to get in an accident situation on the road. I cannot believe how stupid this thing is. Whoever approved this on a direction/navigation application is totally lacking sense. If I could give minus 5 stars I would!!! Google needs to be sued for it.

author: Tiger Qiu
title: Please add speed limits
content: Other gps apps have speed limits.

author: Jfisher73234
title: Current version HATE NEW UPDATE
content: I've sworn by Google Maps for years but it keeps getting worse. The most recent update where now you can't touch and see the directions is TERRIBLE, not to mention extremely dangerous. Sometimes you need to quickly see directions, and now you have to select them from a list? I don't care about the other options. Out of all the frustrating things, this is the absolute worst. Very disappointed.

author: LiQuiD1122
title: Faster route available most annoying addition ever
content: I've been using maps for years but the new, "there's a faster route available" that pops up as well as comes through the Bluetooth (while on calls) is distracting, annoying, disturbing to any call you might be on, or music you are listening to.  I could get behind a suggestion one time while on a trip, where it saved you at least 20% of the trip time, but it will constantly harass you every time you could save one or two minutes, with "faster routes".  When you decline (which requires you to find your phone and click decline, while driving btw, then it will ask again five minutes later.  There is no disable functionality, so this app is now causing more accidents then helping.

author: igup
title: Freezes on iPad 10.5
content:
This has always been my go-to app but on my new 10.5 it freezes up, won't load street views (or takes forever), and locks up when you exit street view. It must be something between the  new versions of iPad Pro with their new processor and google because it works fine on my iphone7 and 1st gen iPad 12.9.  Please fix this!  Sigh.

....Aug. 25 update and it still isn't working on iPad Pro 10.5. Extremely slow and locks up.

author: Buhgawk
title: Quite literally useless
content: If I had the option of looking at a map and planning my route ahead of time vs using this app I would choose pre-planning 100% of the time. This thing is absolutely worthless for in-city travel, because it favors the highway so heavily that it will often ask you to backtrack several blocks just to merge into the highway toward your destination. Even the alternate suggested routes rarely provide anything other than different ways to get the highway even if I can drive the road IM CURRENTLY DRIVING ON without turning for just 3 or 4 miles and reach my destination in a few minutes. Until they add an "avoid highways" option I genuinely believe this app is worthless for GPS navigation and I also very sincerely hope everyone responsible for this piece of trash is tied to a chair in their own home and forced to witness the brutal murder of their entire family. I know it's easy to think I'm joking but I do believe that would be both a fair and justified punishment for making an app this asinine and regressive. Rot in hell.

author: HospodarFamily
title: Terrible update!
content: The new navigation bar ruins the app!  No more "alternate route" icon? Those of us that relied on that function  when traveling for work or just getting around traffic are screwed now.

author: Gold Nevin
title: Wailua River Guides is hostile and rude!
content: The owner yelled and cussed at my wife! We had some trouble finding our meeting spot and when we called the owner for directions we were met with hostility and scolded for running late. When we finally arrived at the meeting spot the group was was barely pushing off into the water. The owner would not let us join in. We paid over $400 dollars for our family of five. My children cried as the group paddled away. We understand there are no refunds but in the very least we should have been offered a rebooking but no. The owner said, not my problem. Beware of Wailua River Guides, they are only out for the money and are not interested in making things right.

author: Whateveropolis
title: Artificially limits features
content: Requires website visit history to use 3D touch. Really?

author: James from Detroit
title: Replacement for Navigation Systems
content:
5 years ago purchased a Navigation system to mostly help my spouse find her way around a new area.   Then as that systems maps grew outdated purchased another more sophisticated navigation system with lifetime map updates.   It becomes a hassle to bring it in and update.  My first few experiences with google maps has made we wonder when those other guys will no longer sell their product.
 I don't think you can convince me to buy another Garmin or Tom Tom.

author: Moazpa
title: You added ads that pop up while I'm driving?!
content: Are use Google Maps every single day sometimes multiple times a day to check traffic. I've learned new routes to and from work that I didn't know before. I just upgraded on July 7, 2017. Now when I checked directions I get an Uber add that I have to close to see my route. You realize a lot of us do this while we're at traffic lights or even while driving. This is dangerous! You need to stop the ads!

author: Bozeman1969
title: Blue Bar
content: I am currently on a motorcycle trip and bounce back and fourth between my music and google maps. Until today when I left the map screen it would always put a blue bar for a quick one touch way to get back to my map. I have an iPhone 7 and would like this feature again. Thanks

author: Smallflea
title: Long distance navigation is not recommend
content:
Google map is powerful in a downtown area to quick search a place you'd like to go and bring you there quickly. However, for a long distance navigation, it's routing algorithm need some improvements. 

I used google map to direct my way from Denver to Rapid city, SD last week. It is an about 400 miles trip. Unfortunately, the path that google selected for me involved a 20 miles unpaved road! We had to drive my new car (brought at Denver the same day) lonely (8:00 PM) with a broken heart. 

So, please use the professional GPS like Garmin and Tomtom if you may lose Wifi and LTE signal in a wilds; otherwise, Google map may give you some surprise.

author: Star Spangle *7*
title: Not working right
content: Was working fine until the last update it doesn't updated sell fast enough anymore please fix it!

author: Japeters16
title: My go-to for EVERYTHINGüôåüèæ
content: Google Maps is always there for me in my time of need! When I'm looking for restaurants, parks, a friends house, etc. google maps is always there! I love the fact that I can save particular places I want to visit and places that I love to visit! Thanks google mapsüòò

author: C1112222333444
title: Roads hard to see
content: The white roads on almost white map are very hard to see since color scheme change. Need more contrast please!

author: Satisfied Heidi Bride
title: Love Heidi Elnora
content:
The difference at heidi elnora is evident as soon as you enter the atelier. As opposed to the cold formality and stiff reception at another local "bridal salon," everyone at heidi elnora welcomed us immediately with warmth, smiles, hugs and pure Southern charm and hospitality.  
We will always remember the beautiful experience we shared with Joy & Liz, making every step in this journey a treasured memory, from the intimate setting for fittings to the official photo documenting our Heidi Bride. We LOVE you and love being a Heidi Bride! 
Anna Knight, Bride
Lesia Knight, Mother of the Bride

author: doxzero
title: A map tool that doesn't show distance!!
content:
So I just realized that although it was already really hard to figure out the distance of a route in the past because it only showed up once for a second somewhere I can't quite recall right now, it appears that this MAP TOOL has totally removed the distance indication everywhere.

You want to know the distance to a single destination, let alone a multi-stop route? Good luck finding that. I looked everywhere and it seems to simply not be available anywhere anymore .‚Ä¶ in this MAP TOOL!!!! 

What was wrong with cycling between destination/route time and distance? Or showing both, showing distance in the route details, or at least having that info somewhere else. I get that most people care more about time to destination, but a map tool that eschews distance seems like a travesty. 

What a huge oversight.

author: Aksbel
title: Speed limit please!!!
content: Anyone could say whatever they want but google maps are the best. Traffic, routing, voice directions. I would like to see a speed limit and a red light/ speed cameras warning. That would make my day!!! Thanks

author: messi10gol
title: Great App!!! Better than apples map
content: It is a great app! I love it simce it is unique and lets you choose places that are on the way to destination (like goin to a starbucks on the way to destination and not taking yoy away from it!) It also lets you do offline amd its traffic trackin is much more accurate and gives you much faster routes than Maps! (Ik since sister and I compared them at same time to see which one was vetter.) Only rrason i am not givin 5 stars is because ot does not have iwatch support and that helps me a lot! Otherwise great app

author: dslang
title: Vs iPhone map
content: With the recent iOS updates, maps on the iPhone has greatly improved and I now use both depending on use

author: ShadowHex547865256
title: User
content: I don't like the update making the directions automatically end once you were supposed to have arrived at your destination.. even if the car is still moving. The app says "you've arrived" and the only think you can do it click OK. What if I missed the turn or didn't see the building? I just think the directions should continue if the car is still in motion.

author: DMagD
title: Super laggy!
content: Lags and the transitions are not smoother.

author: CareyQuiteContrary
title: Speedometer (with speeding alerts) Please!!!
content: I love Google maps and have used it for years. Recently, I have found myself using Waze more and more due to the simple fact that it has a real time speedometer with speed alerts! That and the fact that you can schedule trips for a later date/time and receive reminder notifications for when you need to leave. Those two things, Especially the speedometer would make Google Maps the Best Hands Down!! I would even Pay for those things to be on the app because I prefer the stability and features of Google Maps compared to other navigation apps, but the lack of those features draws me to the ones that have them...Thank You

author: dniqua
title: My Fave navigation App
content: I have been using this app since forever. I use it every single day. When I noticed the green bar that notifies you when you're out of the app was gone I was a little disappointed. That green bar made it so simple to get back to the app if you left out of it. The past few days I've been clicking the area where it used to be only to be reminded it's no longer there. Please bring it back !

author: beeZerdog2
title: Accurate directions !
content: This app is so accurate and easy to follow especially in crazy traffic.  I use this app instead of the built in navigation system in my car

author: ChiTownDave
title: How about giving the fastest toll and non-toll options
content:
First, one has to wonder how Apple is allowing SPAM into app reviews.  

Turning to Google Maps, how about giving me the option to see the fastest route via toll and freeway. Currently I have to switch to "avoid tolls" to see that I can save $5 if I'm willing to drive two more minutes. Also, when I'm sitting in traffic on the highway, the app should alert me if there is a side street route available that is faster.

author: M.L.Cashton
title: Google Maps is Great!
content: I have been using google maps for a long time and I have never had an issue. I love that it takes you exactly where you're going, tells you exactly how long it will take to get there, traffic, and so much more. As long as you keep google maps updated it will do the job it's suppose to do.

author: Calebffhchjchkg
title: Amazing App, Lacks a feature...
content: I have forever loved google maps and how updated the maps are in big cities. However, there is a change I would like to see. In Bing Maps, it allows you to drag your route to any alternate highway/road you come up with when setting a destination. I would love to see this feature in Google Maps in the next few years, or however long it may take to perfect. It would be really great and I'd really appreciate it if you did it. Add it, and I'll give a 5-star rating/possible cash.

author: PwrUser__________1
title: Best maps app
content: Based on my experience, Google maps works much better than Apple maps.

author: Heyyoucanfinish2356
title: One touch directions drop down
content:
Put the one touch drop down list of direction. Stop bringing me to back alley. It doesn't give directions to merge on another highway. It will tell you to get on 210w & say exit 13, but not tell you to merge on to 134, where the exit is and not 210.
Now it just has straight arrows up for the st. You just turned on, instead of showing the next turn. Like go to Burbank blvd. But I'm already on Burbank so I don't need to know travel straight 300yards. I need the next turn.  And final turn to take a highway N or S. not 2 second before the road splits. I need to know the final direction. Either N or S. not both.

author: somethingficticious...
title: Of the 3, the most accurate but a data drain
content: Of the three main navigation apps (Apple Maps, Waze, and Google maps) this one is the most reliable and easiest to use without looking at your screen (because this one will tell you the street names that you're turning onto which makes it easier to navigate without looking at your phone). However this one also cannot give you directions as easily from the lock screen and it uses far more data and battery then the Apple Maps does.

author: Hippieüåü

We had a shrimp cocktail which was excellent. Loved everything about this Steakhouse. This is my new favorite place to eat and I can not wait to go back. Staff so friendly. Great atmosphere!

author: PeaBrainReckons

author: Rezwananis
title: Sudden glitches
content: This app should be the best GPS of all ..... with all its features and graphics etc. But it has some major drawbacks. And it's kind of a major issue. It looses signal suddenly and in awkward moments. Also sometimes it gives wrong route. I had one major incident when I was going to williamsbarg brooklyn from queens it took me to manhattan then showing me the route back to brooklyn . That I stopped using it. Also it looses signal in highways all on a sudden and tells you to make right turn left turn etc which is very dangerous. Also it lacks things like showing speed cams and other cams which waze does. Looking forward for those improvements.

author: Aakilokilokilo
title: Let user choose routes
content: Don't try to be too much smart. Let a user decide which route to take. Just inform...

author: Epcotchris
title: Good App
content: This app is better than the Apple's map app.  I don't know why everyone's complaining.  The travel time is more accurate for the most part vs. Apple's map at least 5 or more minutes.  Example, had to go to somewhere in southern Haines City, FL and Google said it would take me about 40 minutes and Apple said it would take over an hour.  It took me close to the Google map's time than Apple's.

author: Classic01_
title: Review
content: Honestly reader, you don't need to read a lot, google maps is great, it's slick it's fast you can link your gmail account, add favorites, pretty much very function apple maps does but better. Google maps is the way to go.

author: Trucking_15
title: Slow downloads
content: Since the last upgrade it seems to download what you want to see a lot slower then before.. Very good app otherwise hope they fix the problem

author: The.Directory.
title: Gets me there.
content: I've had better luck getting to my destination using google than any of the other map apps.

author: Tapp50
title: I only use google maps
content: Google maps is very reliable and accurate when I need it most. Also, they list all current business information when selecting as a destination. Great for looking at places to eat. 5*

author: David2984820!;9:!,
title: Gazisxebk
content: Lheldgeidho

author: Brian/NYC
title: Latest is Greatest!
content: Always impressed by latest Google Maps features. Biking directions, offline maps, are just a couple of the excellent aspects. My favorite new feature is the Nearby Transit widget for the home screen. See nearby real-time arrival information for multiple subway and bus lines! And you can refresh it right in the widget!! Here in NYC this is especially vital!

author: Simpilot801
title: Great to Good - beware of ONE thing
content: This is my go-to navigation app on both my iPad and iPhone. Google has taken its map navigation functionality up almost on par with my Garmin GPS.  But I have one MAJOR gripe with it - the centering button. I swear that nearly every time I'm close to identifying something really important that my Garmin can't find, my finger hits the centering button and the entire map shifts to my current location. It is the most annoying and frustrating feature of this app. It's because it's in the lower right hand corner, where you typically either type or hold the device.  If that button were in the upper left or right corner, where you could only touch if you intended to touch it, it would make all the difference.  So, beware of hitting that button when you least want to.  A great app will suddenly find itself a good to marginal one.

author: AmotherNickName
title: What happened to "Add to Calendar"
content: Got to say, this has become my Giti app (especially for getting around in cities with subways). But, what the heck happened to the add to my calendar option???? I used it a lot. I tried to use the remind me feature - which first of all causes the app to crash most times I try it, but that still doesn't put it on my calendar... which I need to do. Why would you remove a perfectly working feature for one that crashes the app????

author: Lcmets
title: Horrible update
content: No idea why so much had to change. Now the guidance keeps popping up blocking the street name to turn onto. Constantly have to swipe it away. The old way of tapping on the directions brought up the turn by turn and other than that the GPS and graphic was on the screen clear as day. Gonna start using waze. Roll it back!!!!

author: Hank man
title: To whom it may concern
content: I have nothing but good to say about Google Map, it lead me from Cincinnati to Savanna GA and back non stop. And it lead me around backed up traffic due to an accident ahead. Keep up the Good Google and thanks again

author: Bleph77
title: Blepharoplasty
content: For the last 5 years I have wanted the extra skin from my upper lids removed but more importantly for me,  over 10 years I have wanted the bags gone from under my lower eyes. I did not know which plastic surgeon to use. I just knew I wanted to look natural and not cosmetically altered. So after studying for some time, one day while at my dermatologist's office I was able to read reviews and see pictures of Dr Yellin's work. I decided that day that this was the surgeon.  I was scared and afraid to go under the knife, but upon going to Dr Yellin's office, he and his staff made me feel secure and confident to proceed. The big day came. I had been drilled with post-op instructions. The surgery center was professional and I felt safe. I was off to the OR. For the first two weeks after surgery I wondered if I would ever be ok  The vinegar soaks were my life saver. But after about 6 weeks I knew I had made the right decision and was very happy. I could wear eye liner again! It has been 3 months now. You can barely see the incisions and the redness under my eyes from the laser has almost gone. Dr. Yellin does under eye laser when doing the lower eyelid bags. I recently had a get together with some of my retired friends and this was the comment"You look so good". They  never had a clue I look so natural. I am very happy and pleased.  Thank u Dr Yellin.

author: BeAmazing
title: What the hell happened?!?!?!?
content: I used to LIVE off Google maps. I didn't go anywhere without mapping it out first. It used to be the fastest and easiest app. What happened with the last update? It's horrible! It repeats the wrong directions over and over, it never loads correctly, it starts to reroute even if you're on the correct path. Fix it!!! I MISS THE OLD GOOGLE MAPS

author: Kit.bike.walk
title: Best bike and walk and transit friendly map app
content: Thank you Google for making it practical to way-find for whatever mode I want to use. Bravo!! Used your app yesterday to plan a bike ride with friends from California to bike to a county park about 10 miles from our home in Wisconsin. Tried Apple first and was absolutely stunned to find out that getting there by bike wasn't even an option in Apple maps. Really happy that Google maps adeptly led us along the Ozaukee Interurban Trail most of the way and made smooth connections for the on-road portions. Yay Google!

author: LiittleUnicorn98
title: Slow and doesn't load
content: App is very laggy and the satellite imagery doesn't load on iPhone 7+

author: megspt
title: Bring back swipe to preview
content: I can't read the preview section now that you have to tap to view. Please change it back to swiping or make an option do choose your preference.

author: Saiko713
title: Pathetic nowadays'
content: Google maps used to be the go-to apps for everything, directions, cutting traffic, parking location, etc. Now it's a piece of junk since it simply struggles to get your location through gps. And even when hit directions, it would show you a different starting point from where you are at. The app is trying to do too many things at the same time which just ruins the experience.

author: Claudia from the Sea of Cortez
title: very practical
content: i've forgoten my navigator at home and the one in my car is dated (too expensive to update) but i happen to have my phone and the google maps app. It saved me from getting to my appointment on time,  I found it very practical And the best part I get out of my car and i can continue to use it when Im on foot without having to have an extra devise in my already heavy bag.  I need to try more often to see about extra information like gas stations, restaurants, etc

author: jcb312
title: Disappointing Changes
content: Last update just let me delete recents to clean up during my travels. Now my entire account is linked and I have to delete every recent activity individually again or day by day.  Go back to how it just was and I had been waiting for so long to clean up that way! Every thing else is up to google standards and what I love about google maps.

author: fugly_mofo
title: Reason To Give Apple Maps Another Shot
content:
I haven't used Apple Maps since way back when Cook gave the mea culpa (it was indeed not ready for prime time).

This latest addition of Google creepy surveillance aka "new convenience features" in exchange for additional info about what we do and where we go to sell to advertisers is a good opportunity to see how far Apple has brought Maps since it's poorly executed launch. 

Google Maps location services set to Never and relegated to my "garbage" folder. Let's see how it goes!

As an aside, the best marketing for ANY of these map apps is greater distaste for what the competitors are doing. That's a sad state....

author: Noreen T
title: This update makes Google maps unusable
content:
You now have to select your current point as the starting point for directions, adding four taps of friction to the navigation process. 

When looking at the route overview, text directions do not stay on screen, and attempts to zoom in on part of the route do not stay zoomed in. Map reverts to full map view of the route regardless of actions taken on screen.

author: Mapsuser12345698736
title: Privacy violation
content: This app turns location sharing back on every time you open the app whether you disable it or not. This is a gross privacy violation and should be fixed immediately. They have issued an update and not fixed the issue. It might be on purpose.

author: Doug K1964
title: Great start...incremental additional features would warrant a 5!
content: This app performs very well under most conditions, but it could still use some additional tweaks and features. As many have pointed out, multi-stop destinations and routing can use improvements. Location accuracy is good in most scenarios, but when it's wrong, it's really wrong!  Overall, though, it's still a better app on the iPhone than the native Maps.

author: AlanZihao
title: Navigation problem
content: With the most recent few upgrades, this app is getting worse and worse. It never recognizes me entering a highway exit and thought I missed it. On intersections with a lot of elevated roads, it never knows which one I am at. When there are two parallel roads, it jumps between them and keeps changing navigations. Finally, it always instructs me to weird narrow local roads instead of the main roads. This app used to be awesome and accurate but not anymore.

author: bostonmae
title: Still can't swipe left!!!
content: PLEASE bring back the swipe to the left option back to see next direction. I absolutely despise the new version. The last 2 updates I thought the removal for unknown reasons would be reinstated but still no. Will be looking for new app if not changed.

author: conboy23
title: Google maps is great
content:
Google maps is  the best. It works so
Well I love it so much

author: Grimmead
title: Missing business info?
content: I admit that I don't use this app much on my iPad unless I'm looking for business info after business hours. So I might have not paid attention to this issue but on my iPhone I can access business information such as open and close date and times when planning my daily schedules. The info on my iPad is very minimal‚Ä¶business phone number (not much good after hours), website address, physical address, and a bunch of reviews from Yelp (not in the least bit helpful).  I'm pretty sure that this information was available at one time (I'm suspecting before the Yelp association).  So as an iPad app it's mostly become useless to me. I'll be going back to Apple maps unless it this app (iPad version) becomes useful soon.

author: 2911Design
title: Becoming the worse maps app
content: Google maps is becoming the worst maps app I've ever used. I used to rely on it, but now it is no longer reliable. I live in a large city and it doesn't know toll roads like it should, especially when the roads are double stacked on or below a main highway. It gets confused every time I use it. I've actually started using Apple maps since they have improving. Google needs to get their driving team back out and improve this app before it becomes a thing of the past. Google should also seriously consider using the app themselves in every major city, to see the issues they're having. If a destination location has multiple entrances, this app should know which is the main entrance and lead drivers to it, not the closest entrance, specifically gated communities. I look forward to seeing improvements to this app soon.

author: D.Potts
title: Good because it's free but it's not that good
content:
If you like to make illegal u turns on busy streets to get in front of the business your looking for to find out there isn't even an entrance to that business on that street then this is the app for you. If you ever need to find an address in an apartment complex good luck because Google doesn't place the address you searched on the correct building. In stead it places you in the middle of the entire complex forcing you to search for the right building. If you like routes randomly changing while using the gps option sending you a total wast of time direction then you'll love this app. There are many many more issues but it would take too long to type it all out.  But it is free so go for it because there is nothing better that is free. Apple maps is a joke so use this one.
Update: if it ain't broke don't fix it. Google maps should try to follow that. This new update makes this app even worse. Try placing a pin and get directions to there. It will redirect you to the center of the town after you have started driving... This app is just frustrating now.

1.---get rid up pop ups. We don't need to know route is clear. Or if there is traffic. The color coding and ETA time tells us that in one look.  Don't need a pop to say everything is normal.  
2.---HOME AND WORK SHOULD POP UP FIRST. what's the point of programming them in, if you still have to search for them?
3.---keep the destination on the same st. As the address. If it's 100 main st. Why do the directions say turn on Broadway. Main st is the address not another st.  Didn't ask to get close asked for exact location.

author: Better is coming 2 ME
title: Ms.
content: When I went by Kia on November 8, 2016 it really was to look at 2017 Sportage and from their to look at 2016 Rogue before I make my final decision.  I had been corresponding with Mike Brand through the Internet for a few days as well as a Nissan salesperson.  Both were very nice and after telling them the type of deal I was looking for, both assured me "they would work with me."  Upon arriving at Kia, I was introduced to Lance Williams who made the process so simple and easy.  I rode in back while he drove for test drive as I told him should I purchase vehicle, that would've been an area I would rarely get to sit.  I have to admit, the color got my attention first and it was all uphill from there.  Wasn't my intent but  left driving my 2017 Sportage!  Still learning the operations with Lance encouraging me that I am to call him with any questions and/or concerns at ANY time. Couldn't have asked for a better car "looking" experience or a better salesperson.  Since then, he has followed up with a phone call to ensure my satisfaction.  Thank you, Lance.

author: Love the audio Bible!
title: Goodbye
content: Goodbye google maps. You've been a good friend but you've taken me in circles one too many times. In fact just yesterday you took me onto 2 dirt roads in the rain only to emerge onto the same road we were just on. You could have just told me to turn right instead of left. Just now you had me go past the place I was going, told me to turn right, do a u-turn, turn back onto the road I was just on and into the place I'm going. Thankfully I saw the place and just turned around in the next parking lot. Hopefully the person who programmed you to do that is found and fired. May his little games be ended soon. So, it's time that we part ways. Farewell google maps.
