author: CRC_Idaho
title: Night Mode has 2 REALLY dumb issues.
content:
1- This supposed night mode, under navigation settings has 3 selections, day, night and auto. Use auto, it comes on way after dark. If you select night mode, it doesn't work, and will still wait till it thinks it's dark outside.

2- When it finally goes into night mode, if you navigate somewhere, you still get the same green strip at top showing the next turn. Hardly a night mode when the bright glaring green is glowing on screen. Turning down screen brightness does little.

HEY GOOGLE, ARE YOU LISTENING?

Turn the strip at top to black with white letters, please. And when I switch manually to night mode, your screen should too.

content: For years now Google Maps gets stuck in an endless cycle of recalculating routes if you take a carpool interchange. I'm forced to end directions and restart directions to correct the issue. It is particularly bad on the 55 / 405 / 5 carpool Interchanges in Orange County CA.

author: EmfortheWin
title: Usually works great
content: I've never usually had problems with this app until today. There's a specific way we wanted to go even though we were well aware it'd take us longer to get there. The app kept switching (without hitting the screen or anything) to the faster route, making it very difficult to be sure if we're actually suppose to turn at the next turn. Very frustrating to deal with.

author: last time there
title: Nightmare at BWI location
content:
Our organisation has been renting from entreprise for more than 10 years, I've been the one in charge of this matter. not once have I had an issue till this week. I needed a 15 seaters van for a couple of hours, the local branch I deal with could not find one, I did not give them enough notice . I finally was able to reserve one but from the airport location... that was a nightmare ... I got there to be told if I'm using the organisation business  credit card, it had to have my name and picture on it, which is nonsense to me, but I did respect the policies of the company, I tried to use my debit card that I had on me, well I was told I could not since I should present the associate with an around trip ticket in order to accept my debit card ... I was amazed to hearing this, knowing I only have about 90 mns to take my campers where they had to be ... there were 5 employees behind the counter, one of them stepped up, questioned what the issue was, I explained to him what was going on ... he said there was nothing he could do about it ... I told him they should have explained to me all these details during the reservation ... and then another nightmare started, he asked me how I reserved a van in his location, by now I knew he was the floor manager ... I explained to him I did so because the local branch could not help me also when I called his location I could not speak to anyone since it seemed they were busy, that my call was picked up by a Barbara who happened to be up stairs from his counter, he said there was no Barbara upstairs, he denied her existence just because he did not know who she was ...
Barbara, if you are one of the people who will read this, please go downstairs and introduce yourself to DJ, he said he was managing the BWI location  for 6 years, time for him to know that entreprise has an office at the airport and that you, Barbara work in it ....
I told him that she could not help me she put me back on queue, after a long wait  I got a live person who said he was in Guatemala ... here where the floor manager became sarcastic, saying that because someone helped me in a different language, did not mean they were in Guatemala... that was very stupid since I spoke no Spanish, he did assume that I was a Spanish speaker which I'm not ... he made sure that all his employees and all the customers that were there heard him saying that enterprise has no call center in Guatemala, his eyes rolled a few times , I realized there was no reason for me to continue this conversation ... I had to call somebody else to come and use  his card and we completed the rental ... 
I tried to call and make arrangement to drop the van at my local branch did not feel like coming near the airport twice the same day,  guess what people , I got the enterprise call center in Guatemala again, I was told I would have to pay $50 if I return the vehicle to a different location !!!! 
So, to the BWI floor manager of 6 years, I will take may business elsewhere as you suggested, but ignorance is not an excuse for not knowing , you owe an apology to your employees , coworkers that you choose  not  to acknowledge and your company that pays your check ... next time you may run into someone who will mention that they have made reservations through Guatemala entreprise call center, don't roll your eyes, because there is a center in Guatemala and they all speak fluent English ....

author: IR0NCH3F
title: Needs lock screen view
content: To really make this complete, it should have a lock screen view like the Apple Maps app has (I.e. you can see enroute picture the lock screen).  Also, I found that the Apple Maps app does a better job of navigating me on multi-leg metropolitan trips that utilize walking, subways, and light rail systems.  Specifically, I was trying out both Google Maps and Apple Maps in Tokyo on a recent trip and found the Apple app easier to use because of the lock-screen view functionality.  I could whip my phone out of my pocket every 5 minutes to verify I was still on course.  That being said, I usually confirm a route from Apple Maps or Waze with Google Maps because they seem to have better routing algorithms sometimes.  I still have them all on my phone.

title: Ms. Pac Man - Idiotic!

Very unsafe! Fix the often reported issues, Google!

Why is it necessary to have a blue call out saying the same thing that the top says?

content: Hey is it possible that you can stop causing my map to turn up north every time I use the app it's very annoying. We should be able to hit a button after we locate our destination hit map.. after it maps it should have a icon on the map saying tolls/ toll off and we can switch it any point without having to hit the map it screen. It should automatically change the same way it does when you miss a turn. This is an easy fix for your programmers please I'm sure others feel the same way.    Thank u .. btw you are wayyy better then apple maps. Give them pointers lol__ iPhone 7 + google maps--- also can u make it so we can see map on iPhone screen when locked similar to apple map. It kills your battery life

3. Backing out and starting a new search it is ridiculously inconvenient. There should be some kind of quick way to start a new search without having to press 3 or 4 small buttons located in different areas of the small screen.

title: Navigation is getting worse
content:
It's really bad at giving proper navigation in urban areas.  Especially in the greater NYC area.  Instructing you to be in the wrong lanes causes lots of headaches.  

Route selection is also getting worse and is inconsistent.  Depending on the day it will give me different route options to go the same place.  It favors the wrong roads to use where I live.  It wants to put me on the highway instead of secondary roads which are always faster. 

At this point you'd think the navigation would be spot on.  But it's only getting worse.

title: Less is Not More
content: Very disappointed in this latest version.  I do very long drives (500+ miles several times per year) and in previous version I could customize a Google map on my PC, save and send it to phone via email where it would follow the directions with only change suggestions for traffic jams which it always asked for permission.  Custom directions have disappeared from Google and selecting alternative directions are ignored with no prompting if it finds a shorter route.  I will be uninstalling until I see some real useful features put back in, like posted speed limits displayed.

author: AdventuresInSolitude
title: Make the "Faster Route" an option
content: Google maps has a ill-executed feature where it will find a faster route & redirect you to "save time." This time is often less than 5 minutes. Unfortunately I've witnessed multiple occasions where, without fail, Google will redirect me while I am merging on the freeway, causing me to divert my attention from the road to my phone. The option to decline is too small and requires precise tapping. This needs to be an optional feature that you can turn off. Its timing is terrible and dangerous. I've submitted this as app feedback but I can't in good conscience recommend this app until that feature becomes optional.

author: Tater-mater
title: Frustrating
content: This was the best gps app that I've used for a long time until lately. This app is alway trying to auto reroute you to the fastest route. This isn't always the way you would like to take, only giving a few seconds to click to stay on your intended route. Ive had to backtrack and waste gas, money and time because of this. An example of the reroute problem is when going from Indianapolis to a suburb of Chicago I choose a route that went through Bloomington, IL to avoid the Chicago traffic which can take hours. This app rerouted me to go right through Chicago, even after I selected a path around. Why have the option if it is alway trying to change it. I really expected more google.

Do not update people!!!

author: Pureskrilla
title: Route refresh should be able to be turned off!
content:
I don't experience issues with Google Maps steering me in the wrong direction. 
My issue is with the map route constantly refreshing. Not only does this use up data, it resets the map zoom each time. We often drive in rural areas & the map route will completely disappear if you go in a low/no service area; resulting with us becoming LOST. Please make it an option to shut off. A map app should have a fail safe to prevent a route completely disappearing whilst en route.

author: Fred Doty
title: Highly recommend
content: I always use Google Maps on my computer, but have been using the Apple app on my iPhone to navigate for years.  Last week my friend turned on Google while I was driving, and I thought the directions were about the same as I'm used to.  But when I downloaded the app and tried it myself, it seems easier to use, and I really like seeing the terrain view.  I guess I naturally navigate by landmarks, and feel more comfortable when I see the hills and water features popping out.  I also really like the location sharing function.

author: Michael Bushnell
title: Google Maps is great on iPhone and Computer
content:
However, it is not great on iPad Pro.  It is simply being scaled up from the smaller iPad size.  This makes the app look like crap on the iPad Pro.  Please update the app with native support for iPad Pro.

Update on 7/29/2017: I have become a huge fan of Google Maps since I wrote my original review.  I love several things about it:

1) the offline maps is a huge benefit compared to Apple Maps.  I have spent significant time overseas recently, and having the maps available offline is a lifesaver.

2) the reviews built into Google Maps is much better than Apple Maps.  I found them very helpful in deciding where to go on several occasions.  I have also started contributing to Google reviews. 

If Google Maps were available on Apple CarPlay I would probably literally never use Apple Maps again.

author: Scott_Davidson
title: Rideshare failure
content: Doesn't integrate properly with Lyft or Uber driver apps. Worthless. Why haven't you fixed this yet? This bug has not only existed for over a year or longer, but it's gotten worse! In the Lyft app, when it auto navigates or I have to click on the Navigate Tab (auto navigate is turned on and it works fine wth Waze), instead of navigating me, if I'm lucky you'll show me a "preview" of the route to the given address but you won't navigate me there. I have to back out of that function at least two steps in hopes that you'll sometimes give me the option to manually tap on the little "go" button or the little triangle to finally get directions from your broken app. Waze integrates perfectly with Lyft but I don't feel safe using Waze because it lacks lane assist technology. It's too unsafe to spend all my time and energy taking my eyes of the road just to fight with your app in hopes to make it work for me before my passenger cancels on me. You're supposed to be the best navigation app out there. You've let me down, Google. You've let Uber down. You've let Lyft down. You've let every customer they both have down. I'm very disappointed in you. I have no choice but to delete your app. You would be my go to app, but you're not safe enough for rideshare drivers. Half the time I have to close Google Maps and restart it just to get it to work with Lyft while in traffic. The auto navigate function including route pickup/drop off/stop changes and auto cancel route functions along with a button for easy switching between Google Maps and the rideshare driver's app should work just as it does with Waze. Worthless. Get with the programmers for Uber and Lyft and fix these dangerous problems.

I used this app once before. I generally sway towards map applications that can be used offline. Mainly because I'm not able to afford data. I liked the app. It got me to my job interview at least. Lol. I got the job. When I was going through Franklin county Vermont, I had followed the road that Google Maps told me to go through. I no longer got on that main road, & my cell had COMPLETELY lot all cell phone service. No bars whatsoever. So for a good ten minutes I had to use my better judgment and had decided to go straight down that road. I even tried pressing the "relocate" button or whatever it's called. It would show me where I was and the miles I had until I got to my destination. I thought the whole point of downloading the area(s) of your choice, was to be able to get actual directions EVEN WHEN YOU WOULD HAVE NO SERVICE. switching to a different map üó∫ application. Like I said I liked it before. No issues.
It had also glitches a couple times here and there. Good app. Just needs some improvement.

author: HansG
title: Really really good, but not great
content:
Google Maps is my go-to online map.  There is so many things I like about Google Maps for iPad, it would be impractical even to begin to list them, so I'll go straight for the things that need improvement. 

It doesn't play nice with iPad photos, unlike the browser version for iPad.  With the browser version I can get to any photo on my iPad, but with the app I can only get to certain photos, and I'm never quite clear which ones.  I would not be surprised to learn that that is mostly Apple's fault ("bone-headed choice by Apple" used to be a much rarer event a number of years ago), but work it out.  

These following aren't really an app-specific problems, but they affect the app:
While the error Rate is low, that leaves many errors.  Errors tend to fall into four categories, markers that don't function properly, markers with incorrect information or location, markers for real places are lacking or don't show up even zoomed all the way in and incorrect street/road names.  The last is rarest, and often results from a multiplicity of names (e.g., Lincoln Highway might also be 7th St. and County-2 and Illinois-38 and US-20 as a slightly made up example) or directions sometimes get mixed into a name (S. East Ave. somehow [mostly because of lack of proper punctuation] became Southeast Ave.).  The problem with these errors is that it can be quite difficult or clunky to correct them.  Mapmaker is at best user-unfriendly, though making corrections via the Google Maps is slightly better.  And I say that having a current 94-95% approval rate on around 800 edits.  

While the last isn't directly a problem with the Google Maps App for iPad, and while I definitely see the need for controls in changes to the content of Google Maps, the app can't get better until Mapmaker does.

Update:  The newest update to Google Maps for iPad plays even-less with iPad Photos, and this time it's definitely Google's fault ‚Äî it crops the photo I'm trying to post.  If I wanted the photo to be some other shape, I'd crop it myself.

title: Speed Limit display!
content:
What a wonderful speed feature!  So helpful!  My absolute favorite part is how it only works on I-5 in Northern California!   Superb!  I know Google nerds prob think Northern California is the entire world, but it's not.  Garmin's speed limit display works basically everywhere.  In Canada too.  So does the one in high end GM vehicles.  So I know there is a database of speed limits.   I guess poor old Google just can't afford access or doesn't have the resources to create their own. So sad!   

Also the pop up that says "Fastest Route" and makes moving the display impossible for what seems like an hour?  Love it!  Can't tell you how many times it's made me nearly rear end the car in front of me or yell obscenities with children in the car!  Great work!

I want to easily see my entire drive to/from work so *I* can pick the best route. Seeing only 200 yards in front  of where I am is zero help. Until this is fixed I'll be finding another map app.

author: Erica Jovanovic
title: Nightmare
content: Had nothing but good things to say until about a week ago. My family and I have bought two wedding dresses here, 2 mother of the bride dresses, and over 20 tuxedos between my sister and I's weddings. The seamstress THEY REFERRED my sister to was a complete joke. If I can figure out how to add pictures I will share. Among many things, the worst was the fact that instead of taking in the top properly she literally put a seem down the front of her dress; which would've been seen in every picture. Just to get the full idea the lady had a bowl of chips sitting right next to her dress when we walked in. We were so upset we just wanted to get the dress and get out of there. After telling multiple people at Darianna and showing them pictures they assured us they would make it right. They were horrified as well but after speaking to the owner she said she was not there and we would have to get our money back from the seamstress ourselves. HAH, like we ever want to see that lady again! So after paying for my sister's alterations TWICE, Darianna has done nothing to make it right.

author: SaintGuinefort
title: Not perfect, but very good overall
content:
Sometimes, it doesn't know a street is not through, and, although very rare, it will send me a more roundabout way for no apparent reason. Sometimes, voice navigation will tell me to turn only when I'm basically right up to the street, which when I need my eyes on the road, and not on my phone (hence, using voice navigation), has caused me to miss my turn.
Apartment complexes have been tricky, and it hasn't always been great about zeroing in on the specific apartment building.
There was about one full week, about one year ago, when my navigation a) wouldn't work at all, and b) didn't have a voice.
Once only in all the years I've used it, did it send me in a literal circle. I have no idea!üòÇ
This is all why I won't give it a perfect score, but overall it has been a wonderful app. I use it a lot due to my work - daily. So, these glitches have been not frequent nor numerous.

This is not a criticism, yes I should try to learn the local languages, but I haven't, plus I don't even like to ask directions in my home country. The added benefit is the landmarks and finding out what a monument I see actually is. This may appear utterly naive to a power user, but then, I ain't one.

author: HollyGordonPhoto
title: Google Allows Our Searches to be Exposed
content:
WikiLeaks exposed severe security flaws developed by the CIA. 

The CIA and anyone who gains access to these technologies can use our own computer devices' cameras and microphones to spy on us even if the devices appear to be off.

Apparently because of Google's financial ties to the US government, they have refused to do anything to counteract these security breaches, leaving all Google users more vulnerable than ever to surveillance, even in our own homes.

Mozilla, the developers of the Firefox browser are taking serious precautions in order to secure their users' private information.

author: Weather Control Central
title: Pac-Man? Give me a break!
content: I read this morning that this is an April Fools' stunt. If so, at least it's a SHORT stupid idea. So I'm driving through Dallas on the worst, most manic traffic Friday ever. LBJ is disabled with crashes. I'm looking for alternate routes through areas of the city I don't know well and I'm hampered by a Ms. Pac-Man screen, and worse, a button, on my map. When I try to scroll the map with my right thumb, I can't avoid the button and the idiotic game goes full-screen several times. Dear Google Children, I don't need a cute game. I need a map, and I need it RIGHT NOW before someone hits my car. Never descend to this absurdity again. Act like adults. It's not cute, it's not funny.

author: Nashgoldwing
title: EXCELLENT.
content:
FANTASTIC, UNPRECEDENTED, POSITIVE REVIEW!

We moved into a beautiful house which my wife wished to personalize. We invested in stainless steel appliances, granite counters, new tiles in areas, all new carpeting, etc. You get the point. The top of icing was to be the PAINT JOB, inside & out. Being a registered nerd & proud of it, I researched "Painters" & interviewed several. Read reviews carefully & the choice was obvious:  AZ West Painting & owner, Chris Arevalo. Every review was overwhelmingly positive! Our experience:  fantastic crew of five. They came early & worked all day, leaving promptly at 4:30pm., giving us our house back. They "attacked" the job with energy, gentle care & yet respectfully left the kitchen, the bedroom, TV's accessible to the point we were the least bit inconvenienced under the circumstances. The care with which the furniture was moved & our sentimental delicate picture frames, paintings & artifacts handled was comforting. The paint inside & outside was excellent.
But, above all, after the work was done, Chris, the owner, walked us thro' the final inspection as though it was HIS house! Everything that we asked him to do, be it remove an inefficient mister, or land line phone plates, he did it without charge & good cheer, a nod & a smile! Chris & his crew were determined to please us, & by Jove, they DID IT!! It's obviously part of this AZ West Painting culture, & mission statement.  My wife & I are completely satisfied & grateful for the excellent work. We recommend AZ West Painting, Chris the owner & his crew: great work at a fair price!!
Nash & Hooty

author: TheresainAK
title: Problems with latest version
content:
I am experiencing problems with this latest version that I have not had before. 

I'm currently visiting in Reno, a large town I am only slightly familiar with. I searched for Home Depot. Instead of giving me a list of choices, with spots on the map, so I could choose the closest one, it asked me to choose from three choices by address. How the heck am I supposed to know?! That's why I'm asking Google. 

After fiddling around some more, I found a list with distances and chose the one that seemed to be closest. We followed directions and hit there, but it wasn't the location I expected. On the way back, we passed the expected location, 5 miles closer to home (we could have avoided 2 trips through the "spaghetti bowl" at 4:30 pm). 

Also, I need to be able to turn off the Pacman  game. It is irritating and in my way.

author: Buckeye chris
title: Google Maps is kinda groovy
content:
I don't think I need to say much about Google maps because we all know it's the best, top dog, king, ruler of the streets. My only complaints or two things. First the traffic sometimes doesn't work I try restarting the app turning the traffic off and back on again and nothing works. Sometimes this last for a few minutes sometimes an hour or two. My second complaint is when navigating on street/ satellite mode I've been experiencing some issues. It used to be the little arrows you would click to move now a solid blue line that you slide your finger along to move. The problem is there are certain streets where he goes back and forth from the arrow to the blue line. Also the blue lines are not straight sometimes there's weird shapes that may look like a couple triangles in an intersection this makes it really difficult to move. Sometimes I spend a minute or two just trying to move the map. Also I don't like if your paining the camera around or trying to zoom into a location it always seems to move the map on you. I hope this system can be better in a graded in the future and works more seamlessly. 

                     üéàThanks Googleüéà

title: Big App Privacy Issues
content: The fact that you farm user account info across all your apps on one device and use it without the user permission or without allowing the user to not allow that is a breach in privacy for your users.  Just because I sign into YouTube with one account doesn't mean I want that same account or identity associated with Google Maps and its GPS tracking and farming by you!  You need to give users the ability to separate your apps and not have the same user data and account info intermingled between them.  I don't think you people realize how invasive that is and how much people want to safeguard their identity... oh, but that's right, you're Google, so that should be of no surprise.

author: SrNina
title: Buyer beware
content:
NEVER AGAIN. DISDAINFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE AFTER PURCHASE.
We bought a pricey couch at the Natick store in October, 2016, and
followed the salesman's directions with regard to payment, which
involved obtaining a Crate and Barrel credit card.  Soon after, we
found that a procedural error on his part had created a $600. duplicate
charge. My husband spent hours trying to correct the matter - made
calls, wrote a detailed letter, and finally returned to the store after
politely arranging by phone to meet with a manager as the salesman had
failed to help resolve it.  After driving the 35 minutes to the store,
he was astonished when the manager declined to sit down to discuss the
matter and was ice cold to our predicament. Her hostility and lack of
cooperation were demeaning, bordering on bullying, and he left in utter
defeat and dismay.

author: betsyBeans51
title: Dangerous rerouting
content:
When the app offers to reroute you because it's found a shorter or better route and you don't respond it automatically takes you on the most horrible back alley or pig path roads that you cannot recover from. When you are driving alone you can't watch the screen and take your hands off the wheel to tap the "no thanks" tab. The app chooses the new route and some of these roads are two lane, dark, narrow roads that no one would want to be on.  You should be able to lock in your chosen route and only be rerouted if you have taken a wrong turn or exit. The rerouting should only take you to your chosen route that you have locked in. 
Other than this. The app was wonderful with so many helps for drivers before this bug. But now I would not feel safe to drive alone trusting Google maps to get me there. 
Google maps used to beat iPhone maps hands down but now I must go back to the IPhone Map app for safety sake.

author: forgetr

It hasn't ever given me this problem before, so I'm sticking with Waze unless I'm driving in city areas. Waze typically gives me better traffic data as well.

author: drow93
title: Wish it would show speed limit!
content:
Google maps has the best navigation. It works well in dead zones (as long as you started out not in a dead zone), and it gives the best voice and visual directions in my opinion. It never drops your navigation like some apps I've used. 

I wish this would display the current speed limit like some other navigation services do. I've seen apps that display the speed limit and change the border of a speed limit sign to yellow if you're over it and red if you're over it by more than ~10%. It would be great if Google could add that feature to this app!

author: LImedaiquar
title: Terrible Now
content:
Google Maps used to be a really nice simple app a while back; but now its just frustrating. 

First; saving favorites is a hassle. And the drop down menu makes me furious that I have to search home or work everytime.

Second; trying to pick how you want to get to your destination is even more frustrating after swiping through numerous menus. You click avoid highways but really it means major interstates.

Third; I remember I could just drag the route I wanted to take. Is that feature gone or hidden in the numerous menus?

Fourth; I just....I just hate the direction this app has taken. Its not even smart.

author: Paul in NJ
title: How Can You Not Love This?
content: I have gotten to the point where despite having a built-in GPS in my car, I use this app more than half the time because it is so incredibly accurate. With the downloadable maps, it greatly eases demand on your data limits and frees you up to use it more frequently. The voice speaks clearly and at a good tempo, and you are given a heads up ‚Äì and a automatic re-routing when you run into traffic. If that weren't enough, it gives you a Welcome greeting every time you cross a state line. Even if you don't love this app, you should have it as a backup as you will find it useful at some point when your other resources have failed you. Highly recommend.

title: google maps
content: Great app to use  Usually current info and easy to find things  The reason for 3 stars is it accumulates data from usage which is impossible to delete. Also Why are state and country borders so hard to see?  They used to be ok.  Now sometimes when I zoom in I can't even find them.  WHAT is that about??  Is it a secret??  The quality is definitely going down.

author: Rdd1209
title: Scary / Great!
content: Google maps, like most things Google, is scary in the technology deployed and the ability to track where you are in relation to locations they have "mapped."  I have driven past locations and had them send a notice to my phone asking me if I am at "x"!  Yet, the accuracy and availability of satellite and street view photos is nothing short of amazing.  I find myself cursing the invasiveness of the product and cursing when I cannot find something so detailed to a location I am searching and they do not (yet) have a street view photo of that area/location!!!  How's that for technological schizophrenia!?!?  LOL!!!  Use this product, none are more complete or accurate. Period.  I doubt Rand-McNally can rival them.  Rand-who you ask?  That's my point!!!

author: M3mph1sKyle
title: Still waiting on those bug fixes
content:
Update doesn't fix the annoying bar along the bottom. How on earth would directions to home be useful to me, while sitting at home? Moreover, the app often ignores the first tap on the search bar, to pull up the bar along the bottom. I've tapped "this is not useful" and "thanks I've got it" COUNTLESS times but it will not go away. I can't find a way to disable this useless feature that wastes data by calculating unnecessary drive times. 

Is there a setting to make the "remember settings" toggle, remember to stay on? It's so annoying to have to flip tolls and remember settings, but why should I if it doesn't stay? Anytime another app loads up a destination in google maps, "avoid tolls" and "remember settings" are both turned off. Why can't there be a quick toggle on the route planning screen for this?? 

Google, here's a bombshell, if there is physically NO other way to go, you do not need to give a direction. Any direction that says continue straight onto the road you're already on can be eliminated. "Merge onto the access road" is also not a direction! It is the result of taking an exit ramp. I'm talking about a 1 lane, 1 way ramp that goes from the highway, to the access road. There is no other option, unless Google thinks the user is about to U-TURN BACK ONTO THE HIGHWAY, you can eliminate this "direction." Tell me what exit to take, and the VERY NEXT DIRECTION should be my next turn. When you stuff in the unnecessary direction of merging onto the access road, it hides the actual next direction. I need to know which lane I need to get in before the light ahead! This is useful information! But it's hidden behind a dummy "direction." Same problem occurs with other dummy non-directions, because they always seem to come RIGHT before a real direction. 
"Continue straight"
Okay, I'll stay in this middle lane in heavy traffic and continue straight. 
"Turn right in 500 feet"
THANKS. Now I have to go down and loop back, or dangerously and illegally cut off other people. 

Speaking of dangerous and illegal, we should be able to tag directions as such within the app. I can't count the number of erroneous or illegal direction this app tries to make me pull. To "correct" it I have to screen shot it, remember it later, pull up the same route on the computer, and do it from there. I put "correct" in quotes because none have ever been fixed!! I could make a full time job out of proofing Google maps errors. Seriously, I'd do it, because I'm that sick and tired of getting garbage directions that cost time and money. 

Please, please, PLEASE please give us a quicker way to toggle tolls. This wouldn't be an issue if maps didn't put such a giant priority on using them. MANY times I've turned tolls off to find my route time and/or distance has decreased. Yeah, thanks google, I'd really like to PAY to take the LONGER ROUTE. 

Speaking of errors, the app often gets stuck on a previous direction. After you've made a turn, the green bar at the top still displays it as your next direction. No other spoken directions will be given when this happens. So if you've got your device locked, you won't know there's been an issue until you realize you've gone too far. Sure hope you know exactly where you're going. Oh wait, that's what this app is for. 

Speaking of annoyances. When I'm sitting at a red light, there is no need to remind me of my next turn every 10 seconds or so. When locked, this turns the screen on, wasting battery. Locked or not, it will also speak the entire direction, again, over whatever you're trying to play. I watched this happen 12 TIMES IN A ROW WHILE SITTING STILL before I closed the app. Very common, easily reproducible, just stop at a sign, light, or traffic for a little bit. 

Search along route has been fixed, which is nice. I'm getting the constant rerouting error less. 

STILL will not stop telling me to turn on wifi. I get it! I know wifi helps! It would be on if I were somewhere with wifi!! Do you think there's wifi in the middle of nowhere, or that I have time to connect to a coffee shop as I roll past on the highway? I think everyone with an iPhone knows it has wifi. But if you still feel the need to let us know, MAKE IT JUST ONE TIME!!! I've had the phone and app for YEARS and it STILLLLLLLL tries to 'remind' me to turn on wifi, for no reason other than to waste battery. Seriously, stop bothering your users.

author: xgh
title: For Google Users
content:
This is my second attempt with Google Maps. The first ended quickly when it couldn‚Äôt find my street (>1 million population urban area, plotted 1931, built 1959) and showed a road going across what is nothing but water. Both have been fixed.

My issue is the integration with iOS Contacts is terrible. At best, what you want is buried in a list of Google identified locations (as in businesses that want your money). However, and unfortunately, as much as you look for the location you want to go to, its not there, not in the list. I've tried repeatedly and cannot get the Contacts access to work consistently. 9 out of 10 times, Google Maps does not pick up a contact thats in my Contacts list.

Which means typing in addresses. Not names as you will get a Google list. Want to tell it to take you to the "Murphy's", good luck, it will show "Murphy's 1,000 miles away but not the one up the street that's in your Contacts app. The actual address is needed. Apparantly voice search does not access Contacts, or its utterly useless. 

If you want to be led around by Google, do it. If you're an iOS user and want to get somewhere reasonably efficiently, go back to Maps. Google can locate more addresses than Maps, but the process of getting a route is the pits.

author: G4DJ3TMAN
title: A few quirks
content:
Overall, a very good navigation app apart from a few irritating things that need improvement:

Firstly, Google should understand the importance of rush hour traffic both in the morning as well as the evening time and not force users to make left turns through uncontrolled intersections during heavy traffic and / or gridlock when people are rushing to get to work or their child to school. People who are not familiar with the area will be forced to make that turn causing more traffic congestion or the increased risk of an accident. Google needs to re-write their code to prevent those dangerous left turns during rush hour. 

Secondly, there needs to be a feature of auto accept when a faster route is available because when a person is driving and is not able to look away from the road to click accept, something happens to the display, the direction of travel displayed gets messed up as in, while viewing the direction of travel gets stuck on west to east and cannot be changed regardless of zoom or two finger swipe, the display does not change and we have to shut down the app and reopen to correct the issue. 

Finally, we all use our computers to print map directions, but for some people, their smartphones are what they need to manage everything without the need for a PC, so there needs to be an option for printing in the google maps app as well because if one cannot download an offline map due to either a space limitation or due to having an old phone that is slow, atleast a printed direction can come in handy.

author: HansG
title: Really really good, but not great
content:
Google Maps is my go-to online map.  There is so many things I like about Google Maps for iPad, it would be impractical even to begin to list them, so I'll go straight for the things that need improvement. 

It doesn't play nice with iPad photos, unlike the browser version for iPad.  With the browser version I can get to any photo on my iPad, but with the app I can only get to certain photos, and I'm never quite clear which ones.  I would not be surprised to learn that that is mostly Apple's fault ("bone-headed choice by Apple" used to be a much rarer event a number of years ago), but work it out.  

These following aren't really an app-specific problems, but they affect the app:
While the error Rate is low, that leaves many errors.  Errors tend to fall into four categories, markers that don't function properly, markers with incorrect information or location, markers for real places are lacking or don't show up even zoomed all the way in and incorrect street/road names.  The last is rarest, and often results from a multiplicity of names (e.g., Lincoln Highway might also be 7th St. and County-2 and Illinois-38 and US-20 as a slightly made up example) or directions sometimes get mixed into a name (S. East Ave. somehow [mostly because of lack of proper punctuation] became Southeast Ave.).  The problem with these errors is that it can be quite difficult or clunky to correct them.  Mapmaker is at best user-unfriendly, though making corrections via the Google Maps is slightly better.  And I say that having a current 94-95% approval rate on around 800 edits.  

While the last isn't directly a problem with the Google Maps App for iPad, and while I definitely see the need for controls in changes to the content of Google Maps, the app can't get better until Mapmaker does.

Update:  The newest update to Google Maps for iPad plays even-less well with iPad Photos, and this time it's definitely Google's fault ‚Äî it crops the photo I'm trying to post.  If I wanted the photo to be some other shape, I'd crop it myself.

New Update:  New update to GMfi, and (going against the recent trend wherein major software firms work diligently to make their software less usable), now the auto-cropping is gone AND suddenly it plays nice with iPad Photos; I can find and choose any of the 20,000+ photos on it.  Well done.  Now, if you can make the insertion point for StreetView correspond more closely to the point marked in the overhead view, that should get it to five stars.

4.30.0 update ‚Äî No matter what I've tried, I can't get this update to show satellite views, or much else from overhead among other problems.  (A couple days later this resolved itself.)

4.33.1 update ‚Äî Once again, GM doesn't play nice with Photos, worse than before.  That's a BIG step backwards.  We are not amused.  Also, the insertion point for StreetView remains problematic.  Down to 3*, or even 2¬Ω*.

author: Beauchwagon
title: The 6ft tall Jamaican
content:
I was recommended by a friend to see Sheryl Mazzeo because they thought she was funny and easy to deal with. I came in not expecting much concidering my past dealing with Buford and Atlanta I'll explain later. But Sheryl was very helpful and patient with my very picky self. I ordered a Tacoma with the exact specs I wanted and in my price range. I am so happy my friend told me about Sheryl be I got the truck I wanted and needed. Now here is why to save time and go straight down to Athens. Buford stood me up a man called me at 7:30AM on a Saturday I scheduled an appointment anyway and waited for an hour before leaving and heading to Atlanta where before I could step out of the car I was being pressured to buy today and over my price range I never went back my friend just so happens to call me and refer me to the right direction to Sheryl Mazzeo 
Thanks again 
Daniel Beauchamp

title: Still crashes on latest version of iPad Pro
content:
17 Sep 17 - still not fixed
28 Aug 17 - still not fixed
25 Jul 17 - still not fixed
13 Jul 17 - still not fixed 

More information:  I now know that there are two generations of iPad Pro:  First and second.  Google Maps works on my wife's iPad Pro First Generation.  It's my iPad Pro Second Generation on which Google Maps won't work.

Other notes:  Thanks to Google or Apple, don't know who fixed the other problem - which was, Google Maps was removed from my iPod 4th Generation and couldn't be reinstalled.  As of today, Google Maps is once again on my iPod.

At least I can use Google Maps on all my older devices.

author: BartConway
title: What happened to "remembering" traffic?!?
content:
All of a sudden, with the latest update, the single most important feature of the app to appear instantly when you launch it - the appearance of traffic maps overlaid on the map - is gone. You have to go through two click/steps to "reveal" the traffic layer now, and when you close the app, it FORGETS this choice. Every time.

This glitch means that I no longer can rely on Google Maps on a visual level to choose a possible route to a destination instantly. Pretty absurd. Please fix this, and put things back as they have always been.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÂõûÂ§çÔºöThank you for letting us know about this issue, and your patience as we fixed the problem. We appreciate it! With the latest update, Google Maps should now be working as usual.

author: One-S-ica
title: PLEASE FIX!!
content: With the previous version, with ONE tap on the 3 dots at the bottom of the screen we were able to quickly "show traffic" on our route or "hide traffic" view. Anytime you give a driver a one tap option for such an important key function, you're keeping the them (and others) safer on the road. Now with the new version, while in route, you have to tap on "menu", then tap "settings" which gives you a drop-down menu, then (again, all while driving) your eyes have to search through a long list of options to find and select "show traffic on map", then tap on the activation button. This is way too many steps while driving. Please bring back the previous option or create an option to quickly be able to add traffic view & remove traffic view quickly without taking focus off the road. Thank you so much. Otherwise, I have LOVED this app from the get-go!

author: Jen Slike
title: Dahar Orthodontics
content:
i wanted to make sure every mother knows the total experience you can expect entrusting your children to dahar orthodontics... i walked in to a glowing welcome sign w my daughters name on it... upon entering the reception area we were immediately greeted by a friendly staff member who took us on a tour of the office..
there were massage chairs, a huge 60 inch curved tv, kids having fun w their faces painted and a clown making balloon animals... not to mention an ipad game station and coffee bar for adults...
I was actually shocked to be presented with a gift, and thanked for choosing their office.... I felt completely welcomed and fully appreciated... 
dr nick spent more than enough time addressing my concerns... I could not help but notice the countless awards by local newspapers that they have received from their raving fans, which further reduced any remaining anxiety.... we are now months into treatment and cannot believe how fast my children's teeth have improved, compared to their friends w braces elsewhere... dr dahar assured me of these excellent results usually with half the pain, office visits and treatment time... most importantly without having to pull my daughters teeth.... he explained this is possible by using the latest technology and advancements such as thermal wires and self ligating braces....i cannot say enough about dr dahar and his practice... my only concern is why  anyone would ever consider going someplace else...

content:
I just realized I never reviewed Google Maps even though I use it every where I go.

Yelp is great and all, but the fact that I have to open the app instead of just reading the reviews the the photos within Apple Maps really annoys me. This is for sure a 5-star app and I highly recommend anyone who drives, bikes, or just wants to go somewhere new.

author: Mis pollitas
title: My new Lexus 570 from Herb Chambers
content:
We are a family from Honduras relocating to a Boston area.  We needed to buy a car and  decided for a Lexus 570, 2017.  We visited Herb Chambers Lexus and were served by Mr Hung Troung. This person was really nice to us. He made me, my sisters, and my two daughters very comfortable. Mr Hung treated us as people not just as buyers!!
These people at Herb Chambers are awesome!! They got me set for a Leasing in 48 hours with a little credit history here in USA. They helped me dropping off my rental, getting insurance for my car, and even to get the EZ Pass.
Their facility is amazing. While you wait, you can get free drinks and snacks in a very couzy ambiance. Mr Hung also got me a great discount on the car after discussing it with his manager.
I strongly recommend anyone to visit Herb Chambers when looking for a car. Ask for Mr Hung

Isaac Sherman

author: Made2k
title: Looks good
content:
Performance is my biggest complaint. I have an iPhone 6s Plus and whenever the map moves on it's own, the frame rate is very low. But the most frustrating thing is how bad the map jumps when navigating. I'll be driving down a straight road, and every 2 seconds the map will jump what seems 100 feet ahead, then 100 feet behind, then finally come back to my spot only to repeat in another 2-5 seconds. It's immensely distracting when driving which is not good for a navigation app. I've seen numerous reports of this but still never seen or heard anything about fixes from google. 

Also to note, Apple Maps and Waze do not have this problem when navigating. Just Google Maps. 

----------

Overall Google Maps is definitely the best maps app out there with the abundance of data they've got for places around your area. I've had some trouble trying to see public transport information as I simply just can't find it, even when turning transit on and tapping on the station the train leaves from.

title: Hay, Google. Y'all done effed up this app!
content: I'd guess that about 75-85% of the time I use this app, I'm just looking for a snapshot of current traffic conditions. I've lived in a city with traffic issues (Austin, TX) for 5 years now. I know all of my routes and options. I just want to see where the problem spots are. It used to be open app, zoom. Now it's open app, tap, tap, zoom. I realize this may sound like a trivial issue but, given the number of times I do this per day, it seriously adds up. And, frankly, I can't think of any viable reason for the interface change which makes it even more frustrating. Google, I've already rolled back to the previous version (4.35.1) and am seriously considering my alternativees.

author: TroubleDoll
title: Slow and glitchy
content: I like the functionality of this app but I've had problems with it off and on for at least a year. Especially when opening from other apps like my calendar app (not the built-in Apple cal). I was late to an appointment this morning because I couldn't get Google Maps to respond after clicking on the address in my calendar entry multiple times. It would bring up the app and then nothing. Apple Maps brought it right up. I've had the same experience with Waze working with no problem. And I have to agree with another reviewer that the options are kind of buried in the app and therefore are difficult to access, like getting from the map screen to saved places. Navigation itself messes up fairly often, which is a disaster in work situations not to mention going to events like weddings when you absolutely need to be there by a certain time. Also the font is huge and everything that pops up takes up a lot of screen space. I'm a big fan of Google apps in general, but this one needs some work.

title: Pool Renovation
content:
I spent 2 years looking for a reputable, knowledgeable and trustworthy company to renovate my 12 year old concrete pool. After spotting an ASP truck on Virginia Beach Blvd. I decided to call. Boy am I glad I did. I can't say enough good things about Bill Schlemmer. Not only did he do everything that he said he would but he went above and beyond. Before I even signed a contract, a tropical system hit the area. Bill knew we were out of town. He called me to see if it was alright if he stopped by the house to see about the water level. He graciously lowered the water level for me. The renovation went smoothly but a short time after, the remnants of hurricane Matthew affected the area, again I was out of town. He took care of the pool which was overflowing and full of debris. Additionally, because the pool had overflowed, the water chemistry was totally thrown off. It took a little bit of time and patience but he corrected the imbalance. If you want exemplary service with a smile then I highly recommend ASP pools, Bill and his friendly staff. 

Melissa
Virginia Beach

author: Doctor Mike 124c41
title: Better than Garmin
content:
I have both Google Maps and a Garmin GPS. The Garmin occasionally will give a wrong route, but when I take the turn I know is better,
the Garmin recalculates, and both the mileage to the destination and the time taken to get there drop. Not a very good algorithm. This never happens with Google Maps.

Also, to update your Maps, the Garmin must be taken to your computer, and the new map set downloaded. Google Maps updates itself constantly.

The only complaint is that Google Maps uses data on your phone, and on a long trip, I got charged for data overages.

author: FREE BIRD //
title: New Update üëéüèª
content:
Please add the "Preview Route" to the main page. 
It will make it much easier and accessible to review route instead off opening the setting window. 

Also, remove North Up from the main page. It's useless and it messes up the navigation if it's touched by accident. 

The mute needs to be removed from the main screen and can be added to the setting. It's distracting. 

The "search magnifier" is way too big and it blocks the second turn arrow sometimes as well as the name of the street. 

Google map would look amazing if the highlighted route would be a little thicker. 

The night mode colors are also confusing. The highlighted road gets lost in the background colors and the traffic colors are not the best either. Waze layout and colors are perfect.  

Overall a great navigation. I hope to see those changes soon.

author: Mikeglanz
title: Stop advertising to me
content:
Google maps is by far the most accurate mapping app. 
But
All this constant interruption advertising new features that have nothing to do with mapping is frustrating. The mapping app is for use while driving. I don't want to be forced to deal with an app that wants me to do things while I'm driving. Just give me the directions and cut back on all the required bitten pushing. If I want to know where something is I will ask. I don't need to have suggestions of places I'm not interested in interrupting me while I'm driving.

author: Fergie44
title: Vera Roofing and Construction Waxahachie, tx
content:
We had a lot of damage after a huge hail storm. Felipe Vera knocked on our door and asked if we wanted him to inspect our roof for damage. We were new to the area and didnt know who  we were going to call, so we said yes you can look at the roof. And I am so glad we did. 

I knew the minute I started talking to Felipe he could be trusted. He and his crew have done a fantastic job. They are honest, hard working, Christian people who know their business and are willing to do whatever it takes to do the job right and to your satisfaction. This also goes for any subcontractors  he sends to do additional work. They are all very trustworthy, polite, hardworking people and when they are finished, they clean up every piece of paper, nail, shingle and smallest piece of debris left in your yard or neighbor's  yard. 

I cannot say enough good things about Felipe and Vera construction. My son is using him for repairs to his home and I have asked Felipe if he would do the repairs on our house at the coast that was damaged by Hurricane Harvey. 

I will recommend Vera Roofing and Construction to anyone and everyone I can.

author: SFO-ORD
title: One More Improvement Please - Altimeter
content:
I use this app daily. It's near perfect on ETA. Two thing's I'd like to see:

Updated request: could you please add an altimeter to your maps. It can be very useful while driving. Thanks!

1. Night Mode. Sitting in my cradle at night, while driving, just casts a bright glow on my face. It just seems like this would be a simple addition. Place a "moon" icon somewhere on page and when pressed, the beige stuff goes black or brown. 

2. The ability to toggle which of the three data at the bottom of the screen we would like enlarged on top. Personally, I prefer ETA to distance or remaining drive time. 

I really do love the app. Streetview is great too.

author: Bnieco
title: Maps gone nuts!
content: Yesterday i accepted a 'faster route' that took me to a destination in the opposite direction over 10 miles away when my real destination was 4 minutes away. Now I can't possibly trust it. You owe us an apology Google. I'm actually going back to Apple Maps! That's desperation....Apple Maps' data is terrible compared to Google's. But I can't trust your decisions anymore.

title: Traffic ticket problemüëÆüèΩ
content: The recent update improvements to this app have resulted in an almost perfect navigation tool for making deliveries to residences. This is now the only app I use for navigation. I have discarded all of the others. This app not only tells you which lane to get in before turning at multiple lane intersections, but, most importantly, this app also tells you on which side of the street the target address is located. There is also a smooth, almost unnoticeable, in-transit correction to a new route when the driver disagrees with the originally programmed route and decides to follow an alternate route. The major limitation of this navigation app is that there is no speed monitor or speed limit notification. Because of this limitation, I can not give this app five stars. üé≠

author: mimg1225
title: Not just directions
content:
Love the updated info: latest traffic and road obstructions. 

Once I was in the car with friends driving to a new location...so we had to map it using Google Maps. I was blow away when I saw a yellow exclamation on the map referencing a large trash bag in the middle of the road. Since we knew ahead of time, we were able to avoid it. Such a great feature. I believe it's a part of Waze but nice that's it's available in Google Maps. 

I also love that I can do a search for a restaurant or pharmacy and all nearby areas pop up on my map. 

Lastly, try the offline feature when traveling overseas and you don't have mobile service or Wifi. Route your area while connected to a network and save the area for offline viewing and navigating. Life saver when you don't have a connection. :)

author: Ed&Ben
title: Very Good, Needs A Bit More Flexibility
content: This is a great map app easily beating out Waze in rural areas and usually better than Apple Maps.  There are a few hang ups for me.  I would like an easier way to search for shops and locations near a different location other than my current location.  Also, there should be a way to designate a general region (small city, local neighborhood, etc.) as a place of interest in order to learn what amenities are in the area.  Finally a better way to measure distances between two points, both as the crow flies and driving routes, is needed.  Overall though this still the best navigation app on the market.

author: MultiPlayer356;:35)
title: I drive for a living and use this APP every day.
content:
I use this app every single day and I love it. This message is to the developers please add the following features.

First I would like to say every single suggestion has been develop and implemented. I'm incredibly pleased and feel so heard. 

Another suggestion regarding tolls. 

In Houston, suggested route options I'll prioritize a toll road even I'd there is only a benefit of arriving 1-5 minutes early. Our toll roads can be $3-5. Because I drive everyday, to swap between using tolls or not takes a lot of key strokes. 

Somehow making or showing how much tolls are and possible how much faster we get to a location. 

Or at least a single button toggling between tolls or no tolls would be sweet

Thx again for putting in so many awesome features!!

I couldn't live without this app

author: DaveySprocket
title: Route Changes
content: I'm posting a bad review because I set out for my destination with three different options for routes. I chose the one I wanted specifically so I could go through a certain city even though it was a slower route. I started the route and just after, Google Maps notified me that it had found a faster route and asked me to choose whether to change it or not. I chose no thanks. It prompted me again to choose another route 20 minutes later when I was driving. I did not choose because I was driving and it automatically changed my route. Before I noticed my route was changed, we are going the wrong direction. Thanks a lot Google Maps! Guess my plans will have to change because of your glitches.

author: therickaustin
title: My go-to map app and so much more
content:
Would be ideal (for me) if Google Maps supported Apple CarPlay. Would easily be a 5 star app if this support was provided.

Google Maps is my go-to app for finding locations, direction, businesses / addresses / hours of operation and phone numbers (yes, business phone numbers). I used it on a vacation trip a while back and it chose the directions that were supposed to be a secret way of getting there that cut 30m off the trip.

Would like better way to report directions that are wrong or dangerous (e.g. there's a route in Minneapolis, MN that attempts to send you the wrong way down a one-way street).

author: Ozogirl
title: Needs some improvement
content:
Thank you for finally adding the "reverse route" icon back to the main screen.

A few complaints...

I don't like that I can't easily view turn by turn directions while in navigation mode. I used to be able to tap the bottom bar and the listed directions would rise. Now, I have to tap that bar, then select from a menu all while trying to drive. Please change this.

I need to see the time "without traffic". Especially during the winter when accidents can throw off the time if I'm planning my route for the following day.

I used to be able to save my destinations with a "star" after I arrived. Why take that away? And the new star icon is horrible. Change it back.

When you pay as much as you do for the iPhone and iPad you should be able to use it like you want and not be forced. 
I am a Windows person and wish that the windows phone would become popular so that the people who build all these wonderful apps would make them for the windows phone. author: claudiachan19
title: Horrible GPS
content: I used to love google maps but lately it's just awful. The navigation voice sometimes doesn't talk or if it finally decides to it will tell me turn left after I just past the turn. Other times it will give me a list of directions but doesn't update after you have followed directions so you have to scroll through it while driving to see the next one. It gets easily confused in busy city areas or even along highways. It gets me lost and wastes more gas than it's worth. The only reason I keep it is because when I google unknown store locations it's a lot easier to press the directions button and get immediate directions than copying & pasting the address into another gps app. I hope they fix this I know google is trying to expand its features but the app should at least be able to do the original basic functions it was made to do.

author: Phillysdon04
title: My major problem is when I arrive to my destination
content:
I drive at night for Uber and the new animation drives me crazy when I get to my destination. I resort to using multiple maps just because of this issue. 

I don't like how Google Maps zooms out and stop navigating before I get to my destination. I just want it to show the arrow where my destination is like it did before.

Google Maps should also let me know if the destination is on the left or right when I arrive. 

The name of the street that I'm driving on in navigation mode should to be more legible.

Besides that, Google Maps is amazing. My best feature is the grey alternate route with the ETA. That has saved me so many times!

author: Ted in FL
title: If you like the PC version, you'll be disappointed with this app
content: I love Google Earth on a PC. It is amazing to explore places, measure distance, see into the past, and much more. But, the iPad app does very little of that.  The images are at least two years out of date compared to the the Google Maps app or the PC version. The images seem to be rendered to give a 3-D feel, but this obscures details.  Much of the functionality is missing too, e.g. Measuring distance or path, viewing older images of the same place, etc.  I prefer to either use the PC version or use Google Maps.  Maps has more up to date images and great search functions. So, the Google Earth app doesn't add much or anything to that.

But it kept coming up in the bottom left corner with headset connected when no headset was connected when I was making phone calls received text and while I was in my car. Even while on Airplane Mode.
I tried reaching out to Google with no call back or response period, this has been going on for years. I wiped my phone 3 times it still comes back.
My privacy is important and no one has the right to violate that.
Google how important is our privacy to you.
You have all those brilliant minds working for Google who know what is out there why are you not using them to program safety privacy into your software so Hackers can't get access

author: Electric unicorn
title: Clean no nonsense directions
content:
A great worthwhile app for streets and roads. Definitely worth a try if your non-Google maps app starts acting up or gets discontinued on the Apple App Store.

Update on 1/31/2017
This navigation app gives me simple direct no-nonse directions when I'm driving including warnings up to 3 miles ahead if I need to change lanes on the interstate. This app works for me when others have failed including when another app (not an app made by Apple or Google) guided me 25 miles the wrong way this app got where I needed to go then got me home safely. Thank-you Google keep it up. Does eat battery but then that's your fault if you don't take a car charger for your iPhone with you when driving somewhere you aren't familiar with while using a GPS app. If you use a moniker phone based GPS app please plan ahead and either bring a charger and or a spate power bank to keep your phone from running out of power at exactly the wrong time and place. In this modern world payphones barely exist anymore in the USA. Failure to plan ahead can leave you stranded without a way to connect to someone who can send help to get you home safely.

author: MisterToad
title: Better! Thanks for listening
content:
It seems I'm not the only user unhappy with some recent changes,  as the Maps team have been listening and reverted to the better UI in older versions. Thanks!

The "press to accept" alternative route suggestions still needs work, and this version seems slightly less stable--I'm noticing rerouting delays more frequently.

-----------------

The best navigation app, but the latest version has changed important features so that the app is more difficult to use while driving.

1) the route preview icon is no more: it's been moved to a pop up menu. Much more difficult to use when driving as now it's an extra step.

2) why put a large "Exit" icon on the main nav. screen? The old "X" was fine on the left, which made room for the route preview button.

3) "Press to accept" alternate route announcement disappears much too quickly, and here you DO need a big icon to safely press when driving.

author: A stressed out traveler
title: My empathy or consideration
content: Upon arrival in Bangkok I realized my debit/credit card was lost. I immediately contacted the tourist police in the airport.  Because my flight was so late at night they gave me numbers to call in the morning. I arrived at 4 am to my hotel "wild orchid" and explained to them that I lost the card I had booked with. They let me pay in cash and said they had no other means of collecting payment from me. No mobile apps or such. I paid my deposit for the hotel room and fee for one night. The next morning I requested that the hotel charge my meals for three days to my room so that I could pay with my friends card (he is with me). The hotel refused. I explained that I had very little cash and I was just starting my trip. I begged them to help me. Still they refused. I now am staying across the alley at  same price 600 bhat airconditioning and bathroom in the room (wild orchid shared bathroom down the hall 600 bhat) new Guest house 200 deposit wild orchid 1500 deposit. Wild orchid will not help you if you have problems and the hired help is sarcastic and rude. Thai customer service is much better in most places that I have experienced. I do not recommend you stay at wild orchid instead stay at a more hospitable place nearby. Your mood will be much more positive!

As a result, we are missing important information because we can't hear her in the beginning. I'm sure that it is so that you are not startled when she comes on, but it isn't working for me. I need to be startled if I need to make a turn. Checked all my iPhone settings and Google map settings everything is on max. Ugh!

author: Emnab01
title: Switching back to Waze
content: I have been a long time Google Maps fan and have persistently used it as opposed to anything else. However, on my recent vacation the app didn't tell me where to go on the freeway in a large city. I ended up going the complete opposite direction and my family was completely lost in a city we had never been to before. Additionally, while driving lately, the app has been switching courses randomly while I'm  driving. I'll be on course to go a certain way and then the navigation will completely change and take me a different way without me selecting a different path. Overall, very frustrated with this app and will not be using it again. The lack of efficiency and overall incompetence of this app was apparent when I needed it most.

author: Nerderper
title: You don't know better than me...
content:
I am on a trip right now that I have routed myself. There are several routes to my destination, but I have chosen a specific route for specific reasons. 

This is my first time using the Google Maps app, instead of Apple Maps, and my route has been automatically changed multiple times. I am not watching the app 100% of the time, so a prompt offering to cancel the route change is very insufficient. The default behavior should be to prompt to make the change, not cancel a change. 

I am switching back to Apple Maps until this change functionality is disabled or users have the option to disable it in the settings.

author: Willerpants
title: Meh, used to be better
content:
Laggy and weird routing. Often overprioritizes highways even if they are overly crowded compared to side streets. (Doesn't pick fastest route like Waze or Apple maps every time, picks "best" which is so nonsensical and not always fastest). 

The navigation voice sounds friendlier than Siri but also less clear, like she is very slightly slurring her speech. Siri is superior just for clarity. Also Google Maps recently started mispronouncing many street names I frequent when it didn't do so before. You'd think google text to speech would be more accurate than Apple's. 

Scrolling through maps is kind of laggy, especially compared to Apple maps.

When you search for directions somewhere then exit the app and come back, the directions are often still there, and you need to press the back arrow in the top left, then the x button in the top right, then type something in and press the directions button in the bottom right just to get directions to a new place!!! Ridiculously inefficient.

For comparison Apple maps is pressing the x button 2 or 3 times in the exact same spot for the same result - much less rage inducing. 

Map data with roads & points of interest are still likely superior to all competitors and it is worth it to keep this app installed just for that.

However, sometimes people over report road closures or accidents where they don't exist, like I have some neighbors that report a nearby throughway is closed because they don't like the traffic, even though it's open. There should be more vetting for these reports.

author: UseExperience

author: Snedette
title: Studio N  Albuquerque NM
content:
Stopped in one day late 2016 to ask about their service.  I have special needs for my scalp having psoriasis.

The owner took a few minutes from the customer he was working on to answer my questions.

In addition to my scalp issues, I'm on a fixed income (retired) and needed them to work with me budget wise.

They did!!  Kiana was assigned to me and I just adore her.  They're open 7 days a week, truly care about their customers and provide great service.  

Society is so non-customer service oriented...it's totally refreshing that there are still companies that CARE to provide for us.

I'm a customer for life!

LS-Albuquerque

author: misscady28
title: Add a go back the way you came feature
content:
There are so many things I like about google maps. I like how you can track where you park your car, star places you want to go and make lists to share (which comes in handy when your planning a wine tour) 

The one thing I request of google maps is the option to go home the same way it brings me somewhere. From Upstate New York to Penn State it was smooth sailing. Highways the whole way and we made great time. Now heading home at 11pm and google maps decides to take me through rural Pennsylvania on windy roads with the hazard of many deer. Why google maps? WHY?? What a stressful experience! 

So I plead to you, google programmers, please add this function. If it's already available pleaseeee tell me how to use it!!

author: evike45
title: Hiccups with directions in NYC, etc
content:
1. With other roads overpasses, my route gets confused and gets interfered with giving confusing instructions before returning to my route again.
2. Noticed that arrow on top left for next turn direction differs from blue line, causing confusion which way to go.
3. After turning phone horizontally, it loses direction when turning back to vertical position and I had to stop the car and reset in Settings- not to show noth route but to show my car going (easy to follow and read) south to north on screen. If strictly following a south-north route per position, I cannot read ascertain what's ahead. It automaticaly used compass, cunfusing my direction.
4. On occasion, it does not provide route options at all, though I know they are available.
5. Does not specify clearly which direction to take (nor in advance) when getting to a multiple fork in the road. I've been left in the middle of traffic- not knowing which way to go, then having to make loops to circle back again.
6. Some street signs hidden (trees), unreadable (totally sun-bleached), not in time to read to decide if need to turn now or next block. Have missed turns because of instructions failed to specify "turn left/right now".

Also, the "you have arrived" screen that rotates north automatically is not only bad, it blows it's load too early very often.

author: Lily relents
title: Road closures?
content:
This one-star rating will stand until Google Maps adds a feature to mark road closures (which Waze has had for a while). 

This app essentially becomes worthless when there is an unmarked road closure (particularly freeway), because it will continually try to redirect you back to the closed route until you get far enough away for a U-turn to no longer be viable. This is a huge problem in an area that you don't know well, where you may not be able to go in a helpful direction far enough for Google to change its selected route.

Change this now. It's about time.

author: route66roots
title: Multilevel tracking creepy
content:
Want to not be tracked & sold every instant of my life by Google.
On my way home, with Google Maps OFF, I saw something interesting, got off freeway, and checked it out - about 15 minutes. 
Within 24 hours a promotional video for this costly thing I looked at appeared in my YouTube (Google) feed.
This isn't an isolated occurrence. And app settings were to OFF to save battery.
I'm concerned that location, likes, etc., will continue to generate more content based on what I've already liked, seen, where I've been.
Life at the hands of friendly 'free' Google. 
I'd like an app that I can pay for the service of helping me navigate, while keeping marketers out of it.

author: HansG
title: Really really good, but not great
content:
Google Maps is my go-to online map.  There is so many things I like about Google Maps for iPad, it would be impractical even to begin to list them, so I'll go straight for the things that need improvement. 

It doesn't play nice with iPad photos, unlike the browser version for iPad.  With the browser version I can get to any photo on my iPad, but with the app I can only get to certain photos, and I'm never quite clear which ones.  I would not be surprised to learn that that is mostly Apple's fault ("bone-headed choice by Apple" used to be a much rarer event a number of years ago), but work it out.  

These following aren't really an app-specific problems, but they affect the app:
While the error Rate is low, that leaves many errors.  Errors tend to fall into four categories, markers that don't function properly, markers with incorrect information or location, markers for real places are lacking or don't show up even zoomed all the way in and incorrect street/road names.  The last is rarest, and often results from a multiplicity of names (e.g., Lincoln Highway might also be 7th St. and County-2 and Illinois-38 and US-20 as a slightly made up example) or directions sometimes get mixed into a name (S. East Ave. somehow [mostly because of lack of proper punctuation] became Southeast Ave.).  The problem with these errors is that it can be quite difficult or clunky to correct them.  Mapmaker is at best user-unfriendly, though making corrections via the Google Maps is slightly better.  And I say that having a current 94-95% approval rate on around 800 edits.  

While the last isn't directly a problem with the Google Maps App for iPad, and while I definitely see the need for controls in changes to the content of Google Maps, the app can't get better until Mapmaker does.

Update:  The newest update to Google Maps for iPad plays even-less well with iPad Photos, and this time it's definitely Google's fault ‚Äî it crops the photo I'm trying to post.  If I wanted the photo to be some other shape, I'd crop it myself.

New Update:  New update to GMfi, and (going against the recent trend wherein major software firms work diligently to make their software less usable), now the auto-cropping is gone AND suddenly it plays nice with iPad Photos; I can find and choose any of the 20,000+ photos on it.  Well done.  Now, if you can make the insertion point for StreetView correspond more closely to the point marked in the overhead view, that should get it to five stars.

4.30.0 update ‚Äî no matter what I've tried, I can't get this update to show satellite views, or much else from overhead among other problems.

author: Love the Brit
title: Traffic setting change is awful
content:
Before the update, the traffic setting would remain on at all times, after the update, the user is forced to turn it on every time.  Seems odd that everyone working at Google never used the traffic setting much and felt forcing a user to manually turn it on every time was an "improvement", truly a very poor decision
 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

author: SuzanneSkoog
title: Pool
content:
In 2016 my husband and I had our pool remodeled by Aquavida, a company that reportedly has completed over 4000 pool remodels and has over 27 patents. The end product was flawed, a complete disappointment, and we came to the sickening conclusion we had to gut it out and start over. 

Kristian Hill, who had completed only 25-30 pools, managed to bring our pool vision to fruition. He took the time to enable us to create a beautiful design. He was easily accessible and maintained a pleasant positive attitude throughout the entire process. 

If you are looking for a contractor who truly cares and wants to please his customer, I highly recommend Kristian Hill.
